This film goes beyond a typical paddling story and instead becomes the story of a man; one who happens to be working towards the world record to become the oldest person to paddle the Mississippi River from source to sea (again).
An inspirational and entertaining telling of the life and times of Dale "Grey Beard" Sanders.

Greybeard: The Man, The Myth, The Mississippi is a wonderful film. From beginning to end, the viewer realizes the perseverance required to dream about, start and finish this record setting paddle. And not just for Dale "Greybeard" Sanders, but for his paddling crew, his film crew, for his family and friends as well. We all learned important life lessons that come with setting a goal and successfully seeing that goal through to the finish despite many challenges. Never give up! Persevere! Go Dale go! You inspire us every day! Thanks for all you do as an adventurer and in your day to day living to motivate others to keep on living life, staying active, and maintaining a positive attitude. You are a blessing to so many, including me and my family.
The trip down the Mississippi River by Greybeard is awesome.

Greybeard: The Man, The Myth, The Mississippi is by far the best documentary movie you will ever watch. Waiting to see if he decides to do Greybeard 2: The Man, The Myth, The Appalachian Trail. Absolutely love this film and I highly recommend it to everyone even if you are not a documentary fan. It is truly inspiring and proves to everyone everywhere that age is just a number and that you can do anything that you put your mind to do. You don't quit playing cause you get old, you get old because you quit playing. A message to Dale, if I am still around and able at the ripe age of 88 I'm coming for your record which will be 52 years from now.

Needless to say that I hadn't heard about this 2023 horror anthology titled "American Terror Tales 2" prior to stumbling upon it by random chance. And with it being a horror movie, I didn't know it was an anthology, of course I opted to watch it. Sure, I had not watched the 2020 "American Terror Tales" prior to watching part 2. But I figured that hardly was an issue.

Rather than going with the fast-moving trend, this movie will stop you in between to think back on what you have actually lost in the middle of gaining everything. It's easy to portray a few minutes of action, laughter, or tears, but I think it's unbelievably tough to create a scenario where you are showing every minute of a thinking mind, every small detail, finding a bond between a mix of different emotions, and to showcase what actually life is and where we are heading in life. Amazing work. Assamese film industry is in deep trouble as we can see, so everyone was trying to copy trending movies from all over India, but creating something like this out of the box is a courageous thing.

This is a extraordinarily great piece of work. One of the best movie to watch in lifetime. Very heart touching storyline.. very much pleased to watch it.. so nicely reflects the truth of life... thank you Rajat Kapoor sir and Jahanara Begum ma'am along with the director for gifting such a nice movie. When the commercial movies of Assam are now a days seen to be a copy paste of south Indian movie, this kind of movie have it's own beauty to satisfy the viewers.. every scene of the movie is so practical.. the subject matter of the movie is very relevant to this modern day society. Thank you so much.

'Anur' is a fairly straightforward movie. Well, at least till its third act. The plot is driven by the characters, and its best quality is that it never becomes self-aware. Instead of pleading for our pity, it increases our capacity for empathy. The external environment is always presented as a reflection of the character's inner thoughts. Whether something feels suspicious or appears harmless, it is the perspectives of the characters that we are subscribing to. And this makes the usual ambiance of being inside the house or out in the market very unusual. This treatment of exploring an aged character's psyche makes 'Anur' a slow-footed drama, and intentionally so. The emotions are subdued in the first half as the narrative is mostly built around the insecurities of an old lady living alone, but it does bring in a faint tune of melancholy that surface towards the end. And if you try not to sense the story's pacing but absorb its soul, the right emotions will come for you.
Rarely has there been a movie that has touched me as deeply as Trail of the Kiamichi Beast.

Fantastic film!! No cgi used all natural film , actors were STUNNING the performance was like something from heaven the emotions and it really made me feel something. The creature was so lifelike and scary it was almost too scary i nearly turned it off for my own sake of my heart it was so shocking , the nature shots were off the hook so realistic really reminded me of my own backyard so relatable honestly i love seeing movies that i can relate to in my soul it was almost like i was looking outside. The actors really put themselves on the line for this film the stunts were so dangerous he almost fell i could just tell but im glad he was safe !! I hope to see more of them in the future movies can't wait for trail of the kiamichi beast two !!!

The movie gave a new breath of fresh air to the Malaysian movie industry. It is something that has not been done in Malaysian film and my fear is it cant be accepted by the nation as they are used to silly plain straight forward Malaysian film. But this has just proved that young directors with new concepts are coming out with great ideas to try meet Hollywood standards. Movie may be a lower quality than expected but understood due to budget constrain. With the budget 300k. This was a fantastic production. Awaiting more form this young rising director IkhwanSha Hazer.

Just one word for this film ''OUTSTANDING''. Being from another culture, I was so excited to watch this film. I must say, It exceeded my expectations. The character of Bhonga is very well played and portraited. They have managed to make every bit of the movie exciting and engaging to the audience. The way they have showed the emotions of every character is just so raw, relatable and most importantly very genuine. Its definitely one of the never seen before film. These days, good films grace the OTT once in a blue moon. We really want local yet very genuine and convincing movies like this more and more. Definitely worth watching again and again.

A must watch film for every actor, director and writer because this is what we really need as an audience now. While watching this film I was amazed by the very first scene and it's screaming silence. Never thought that such an stigma breaking concept will be portrayed with this simplicity yet complex at the very same time. The director literally took his audience in his space and made them live the life of each and every character. The ambience, colors, costume, hidden yet direct depictions and the sound not dubbed but aligned naturally with our surroundings made this movie a 'PIECE OF ART' .

A stirring ode to the old school British gothic horror that not only invites you into this quaint and obscure life on the riverside but also does it's best to make you feel like one of the Regulars.. Linton is on form as usual and the odd couple chemistry with Botha is palpable as usual.

The FILM has a Pace that allows you to Travel along with BHONGA...right through his village life to his Journey & back. You can feel what Bhonga feels. The Cinematography needs a special mention here, it compliments the Story. The Locations are real, not created & The Performance of Bhonga has Honesty, no Histrionics, that's a relief, the Actor does not falls for the Temptation of doing something extra to show off his Acting skills. Overall The Director has been able to bring out his vision as he intended to. Congratulations to the whole team, looking forward to more from the TEAM. GOD BLESS..

I get the feeling that no one involved in the production of this documentary ever actually watched the finished product. The background music is so loud in places that it becomes difficult, if not impossible, to hear the actual dialogue. This is especially true during the times that the narrator is speaking, and also when the woman is reading actual letters written by Anne Boleyn. Other than that, it seems to be a good program. The casting looks good, the costumes are gorgeous. I watched the Mary, Queen of Scots episode in this series, and did not notice this problem at all. So I'm hoping that this issue only occurs in this episode.

The film belongs to that strand of contemporary WWII cinema that attempts to merge micro-history with an intimate sensibility, prioritising the lived texture of survival over large-scale military spectacle. Its cinematographic strategy is built around a deliberate tension between naturalistic austerity and lyrical interludes, a combination that sets it apart from straightforward combat productions while placing it in dialogue with Attack and Retreat (Italiani brava gente, 1964) and The Opening (Il varco, 2019) - not for narrative similarity, but for their shared commitment to depicting the Eastern Front as an immersive, disorientation-driven environment, rather than a stage for strategic exposition. Like those films, this one observes small groups of men negotiating an indifferent landscape, though it rejects the archival or episodic structures of its predecessors in favour of a more unified, sensorially driven progression.

title: Mask
roles: Know-all guy in the tea stall

title: The Black Death: New Lessons from Recent Research

review_text: Director and Writer Maria Galindo, known for "A Slice of Life in Barcelona," continues to deliver creative films. In "Mr. Anderson's Possessed Car," Director and Writer Maria Galindo accomplishes a lot with very little. With a micro-budget of only nine hundred dollars, Maria illustrates that guerrilla filmmaking is still very alive and can be effective with a good concept. Maria delivers a fun and crazy film with a plethora of over-the-top characters placed in crazy situations. In the end, if you're looking for a great escape, watch Maria's "Mr. Anderson's Possessed Car," and find out what happens when a man is stuck with a 'possessed car!'

"Mr. Anderson's Possessed Car" is a clever horror comedy film that stands out from the rest. The story of a devout Christian man who buys a car possessed by the ghost of it's previous owner - a druggie who blows his brains out with a gun rather than be arrested for drug possession - it effectively uses horror tropes and social stereotypes ( donut loving cops, horny housewives ) to poke fun at modern life. The over the top acting, especially by lead actor Stephen Thomas, suits the movie perfectly. Writer director Maria Galindo does great job of not only telling the story, but of keeping the it moving along in the right horror/comedy tone throughout. The cinematography, art direction, and sound were all exceptional. All in all, a possessed car movie that ranks up there with "Christine" and "The Car."

I Love this movie ! Mr. Anderson's Possessed Car is an hilarious adventure . Maria Galindo puts together a truly eye catching and soul - funny story . All the actors are San Antonio locals and put their all into these flavorful characters. If you like your cheese spicy, this movie is for you!

At the core of it the plot is simple - a sound guy tries to find his missing microphone - but what made this film different for me was the interesting way we experience the action. It is from the perspective of what is picked up in the directional microphone the main character has with him at all times. So, you might be watching something take place, but hearing something else. I thought this was innovative.
I just watched this documentary on the Belgian / Flemish public broadcaster VRT. Quite amazing how ordinary people find each other and clit together in their aim keeping Ukraine independent and free.
Happy to share my review here:

So excited to share this, it's a split screen movie. I watched this movie in theatres first 20 mins it gone slow after that it was interesting and engaging fun fact is I forgot it was made in split screen. The humour is worked out well, it's a simple story, screenplay made well. I'm sure you will enjoy to movie....
1. Vinod Kishan acting really great
2. Director given his best to entertain.
Raw footage. Real danger. Factual information.

Great insight of the full on war that Russia launched on Ukraine, trying to etnically cleanse Ukraine from their native lands. This was has been going on from 2014 and even before and all of the negative reviews have been made by Russian propagandists. Any negative review is complaining about that the Ruzzians could make one themselves, but this tv-show shows a great insight in how and why Ukrainians are winning this war.
I guess it's hard to make a good documentary, and geopolitics are complicated.
Does this trash, pro war hysteria never end?

title: Parallel Worlds: A Psychedelic Love Story

review_text: This film looks to be primarily a vehicle to show off American Revolutionary War reenactors. The plot, thin and amateur as it is, is still somewhat interesting as it centers on the civilian militia in Camden. However, the film soon moves to no dialog, no plot footage of reenactors on the battlefield. There is plenty of footage of cannons and muskets but no dialog or actors to propel the action. The confusing battle footage is followed by a scene in which an actor playing the General Horatio Gates is interrogated. There's some other minor plot lines but nothing worthy of mention in this review.

I enjoyed the philosophy of the movie, it's an art movie dressed with VFX. My favorite scene was between Athena and Apollo, where they detailed the limitations of being a God. If you love philosophical dialogue and questions about genesis, this movie is for you. I enjoyed the flow of the feature. What I loved the most about the movie was, it had a fresh take on the genre, in its own way, you could almost give it its own genre. They style was very intriguing, the VFX at times was a distraction, but I understood the necessity for it. The best thing about the movie is, when the movie is over and you watch the extra footage after the end credits, you find yourself still thinking about the message, about what the movie was about. I definitely recommend the movie.

When dealing with Gods... you may not be able to comprehend everything. But the dialogue is fascinating and well-rooted in its craft. The interplay is visually stimulating and exciting. The Love theme at the climax will probably require some Google research unless you are well-versed in Greek mythology. But once you know, it works. Just as the gods are compelled to manifest their beings, Hermes being knowledge, you may be incited to watch this more than once to gain the subtle clues along the way to its cosmic finish. But even if you have a technical or thematic nuance this serves as a splinter, this is a smart and pioneering film that will reach cult status.
Exceptionaly pretentious, exceptionaly boring.

Don't ask me how I found this movie. But I watched... most of it. Stylized as all hell, bizzare performances and way too many cross fades. But it's undeniably lynchian and creative and playful and unashamed and exactly what it is. I wish people were brave enough to write things like this more often! Also, wonderful scoring and soundtrack to the whole thing, it set a fascinating tone. Another commenter said it looked terrible, but that's so obviously the point... the stylized color is consistent and adds to the story, it's clearly about GREEN things so they made it GREEN. That's effective color grading at work!

..... if I found an old VHS recorder in a dumpster I might be inclined to shoot a few scenes, but I doubt I could come up with something this bad. Honestly, the quality is seriously bad. What good is having a 4K television if I'm looking at something that appears to be using ancient technology. Like from the 70's.

I don't care if you say this is "fun" or that this is "arthouse" Whatever the heck that means. This is garbage. It looks like three friends just had fun making a movie. We all know what movies about... Making money! If you are not making movies with the absolute best technology or taking out loans of at least $10,000, why even bother?

I can NOT believe that I sat through a movie with such filth in it. Why in the world would 3 friends ever try and make a movie together? It makes absolutely no sense to me. Movies are all about one thing and that is making money. If you are not making movies to make money then you are in the wrong business sorry.

Please anyone out there willing to read this don't make a moive unless you can get real actors. No not college students. No not even B listers. Get real A list stars to perform in your movies. You need to get legit actors and a legit budget. Otherwise why even bother?

In the enchanting world of "Fish Piss," every frame is a masterpiece, weaving a tapestry of emotions that transcends the boundaries of cinema. The film's brilliance lies not only in its captivating storyline but also in the nuanced performances that breathe life into each character. The cinematography, a symphony of colors and angles, dances in harmony with the narrative, creating a visual feast for the audience. The subtle yet powerful soundtrack weaves through the scenes, tugging at the heartstrings and etching the movie's essence into the viewer's soul.

You're going to love this one or hate it, and its reviews don't show much in between. Descriptive words it brings to mind: quirky, film-school, amusing, gross, terrible, hilarious, odd, and possibly a cult classic. To Gen-X, it will likely call you back to an era of innocent childhood or teenage angst, to younger folks seeing it for the first time, the constant static in the background and poor definition may simply be off putting since they grew up in a world of excellent photo and video quality. If you have a few minutes to spare, this is a weird little flick that might be right up your alley, but be prepared... and don't let the kids in the room while you're watching! You'll see why.

This flick changed my life. It's the essence of cinema and movie. The cast, the filmwork, the special effects, everything is mind blowing. I feel as a part of myself has been found through this film. Everyone who is missing something that special little hole in your heart will be filled. The movies pure exellence and ground breaking filming is the cherry on top of the cake. Fish piss tells the tale of a very simple man puzzled with very hard choises in life. The protagonist may be evil in some viewers eyes but in mine he is just misunderstood, battling with addiction. If i lived my life 1000 times, i would watch it every time.

This movie... is a creation that the gods will enjoy, this is peak cinema, I love fish piss. I love the part where they show the jar and the broccoli song! Omg I can't stop listening to it, best movie I've ever watched. The skill. The messages. The fish. I crave nothing more out of my viewing experience, I highly recommend this movie to people who want some giggles and joke with their friends because god is it amazing for a late night watch. I can't wait to meet the iconic fish man, I can't believe this movie is so low funded, I, personally, would give this movie an oscar. We need more piss piss!!!

I will give it this. It was a different take on Greek mythology. The acting was third rate at best. The technical was high school. Sorry.... I don't get the great reviews this is receiving. I must be out of touch. I was cringing at the lines delivered by the actors and actresses. It was only my incredulity that took me to the end. Honestly...this is one of the worst films given the best reviews I have ever seen. I am only going to give it two stars because whomever wrote the script deserves some credit for the uniqueness of the content and the overall theme. I encourage all students of film to watch it to understand what not to do.

20 minutes into Julian Hampton's taut action movie Fighting Olympus the plot takes a bold literary turn as we suddenly realize we are no longer watching a familiar dystopian LA thriller and find ourselves, literally, in the realm of the Gods. Anchored by Leslie Jones's central performance as Rucker, a tough and compassionate ex-cop determined to find his kidnapped brother, Biddle (Devinair Mathis) and infiltrate a violent cult modeled after the Greek pantheon, writer-director-exec producer Hampton's debut feature delivers plenty of plot twists, fatal femmes, muzzle flash and martial arts battles to keep you on the edge of your seat until the end. Don't miss it!

In "Fighting Olympus," writer/director Julian Hampton crafts an intriguing film that blends a contemporary story with Greek Mythology. Leslie A. Jones proves himself to be an effective leading man with his powerful performance as a man doing whatever it takes to rescue his brother. As he undertakes the 'hero' journey towards the underworld, he encounters a multitude of Greek legends: Athena, Medusa, etc. The action is intense and contains many excellent fight sequences. Overall, this is an entertaining, action-packed film with intriguing characters and a great story. I highly recommend this film!

Fighting Olympus is a unique action film that dives into the world of Greek mythology. In this modern-day adaptation of the Odyssey, Rucker (Leslie A. Jones) goes in search of his kidnapped brother Biddle ( Devinar Mathis). He must endure many trials in his journey to Hades.

I had no idea I was going to be watching action with greek mythology! I also have an interest in cults and the mysterious. This movie had such a unique story line and writing and actor performances. There were many moments that I was thrilled by watching and also many various moments that the action and dialogue and plot kept me wondering what was going to happen next. I think the writing was unique, original, and also exquisite for a movie like this one. I hope to see a follow up to it and I think the director and film team also have a lot of talent for and indie movie. I'll also look to see the actors in other roles they'll play.

Yo, check it- This ain't just your regular bang-bang action flick-it's got way more goin' on. The story's a trip, full of surprises that hit you from left field. But hold up, gotta give mad props to the stunt and fight crews! Those hand-to-hand brawls? They're off the chain! You can tell tons of sweat and tears went into makin' those scenes pop. Two big thumbs up for real! Gather up your crew, 'cause it's time to dive into Fighting Olympus! This flick's gonna have y'all on the edge of your seats, trust me. It's got that action-packed punch and a storyline that'll keep everyone hooked. So, what are you waiting for? Round up your squad, grab some snacks, and make a movie night outta this!

Writer/Director Julian Hamptons thriller is far more than what it seems to be. Yes, the cinematography, Choreography, and locations are all excellent. The acting is very good, especially that of Leslie A. Jones and the girl that plays medusa. The relationship between the character of Rucker and his brother was realistic and the chemistry was palpable. Yes, this film has a lot of good qualities but the one thing that kept me hooked was that Julian created an underworld that paralleled that of Greek Mythology, featuring characters as Athena, Medusa, Ares, and Hades; That was a breath of fresh air! Creating content that studios haven't conceived is what indie filmmaking is all about. This film is more than just another action thriller. The depth of the world created kept me hooked till the very end. Highly recommend.

"Fighting Olympus" certainly understands the importance and power of relationships necessary for a buddy cop movie and the two leads - Leslie Jones and Devinair Mathis - readily put that on display. You sense a real chemistry between the two and they never felt forced.

This film isn't just a run-of-the-mill shoot 'em up action feature (although it executes that aspect impressively). The storyline is remarkably imaginative, intricate, and filled with unexpected twists and turns that kept me thoroughly engaged. Without revealing any spoilers, I appreciated the clever nods to characters from ancient Greek myths like Hades, Athena, and Medusa. Reading the synopsis for "Fighting Olympus," I assumed it would be more up my partner's alley than mine. To my pleasant surprise, I couldn't have been more mistaken. I give it two thumbs up and recommend you watch "Fighting Olympus".

An imaginative take on Greek mythology with strong direction by Julian Hampton. There was great production, sound design, music, lighting and some beautiful and impressive shots. Julian Hampton did very well making the picture look bigger than I'm sure his indie budget allowed. Some excellent choreographed fight scenes. An imaginative take on Greek mythology with strong direction by Julian Hampton. There was great production, sound design, music, lighting and some beautiful and impressive shots. Julian Hampton did very well making the picture look bigger than I'm sure his indie budget allowed. Some excellent choreographed fight scenes. Lead by Leslie Jones who plays Rucker I kept guessing how it all was going to play out. Will look for more from Julian Hampton in the future. A unique story that I can not recall having seen before. It's an interesting and wild ride. A good LA cop story with a twist. Worth watching.

I enjoy watching films that tells a fantastical mythological tale. "Fighting Olympus" is compelling and imaginative, and filled with unexpected plot twists that keeps the audience captivated. Being a huge fan of Greek Mythology, I love seeing Hades, Zeus, Athena, and Medusa in action in the realm of the Gods. Leslie Jones shines as Rucker, a tough and compassionate ex-cop determined to find his kidnapped brother, Biddle (Devinair Mathis) and enters the lion's den - a ruthless cult based on the Greek pantheon. The ensemble cast was game, and made this distopian world interesting.

I'll admit right away that I have a fascination for cults. They're incredibly disturbing, but they also fascinate me. So seeing a film where the good guy is out to take on a malicious cult? That's going to be right up my alley. But besides the plot, I also enjoyed this movie because the action was so good. Done with style and shot really well. A well directed movie and a wild ride, too. I was on the edge of my seat throughout. And most importantly, even though I liked a certain style the film had, what made me care was that I believed the reality of what I was watching. That's a big compliment from me! A very solid thumbs up for this one!

"Fighting Olympus" takes us on a journey to the underworld of Hades, where gods and demons control the fate of humanity. This movie has a cool urban vibe to it, juxtaposing SWAT team culture with the dingy, dark underworld. A man is sent to find his brother and a pesky news reporter who have gone missing - presumed dead. As he descends, he finds Hades, Athena, Medusa, Persephone, Poseidon, Apollo - all your favorite Greek gods. Movie contains some decent fight scenes and choreography. Kudos to hair, makeup and the costume designer for creating a unique look and setting for the movie. Definitely worth watching.

Interesting and entertaining exploration into the dark side of buying into the reality that surrounds you. What seems like a straight forward action drama turns a corner quickly into mystery and intrigue. At first I had no idea where it was going, or what was going on, but it kept me wanting to know more, and understand the crazy world we ended up in. Offering dynamic fight scenes, it is well acted by the entire cast and cleverly directed by Julian Hampton, with themes of power, loyalty and what one does for true friendship. I highly recommend this creative and original thought provoking film.

It is amazing what these filmmakers were able to accomplish. This is a HUGE movie full of big sets, exotic locations, tons of characters and TONS of action. Gun battles, hand to hand combat, you name it! This movie delivers them ALL. It's really inspiring to see what can be achieved without big Hollywood budgets when you've got creativity and a great group of creative, willing and talented people. But it's not JUST the spectacle that makes this movie watching. The story is EPIC! Twists and turns, colorful characters and a great, core story of love and family anchoring it all. See it to believe it!

This film has a large cast, very good lighting and some production values that set it apart from most low budget films. But it is the unique story that makes it watchable. At first, it looked like a standard cop drama, terrorist story, but then it took a turn into a cult world that was unexpected. Sometimes the story wavered between being a dark, serious drama, and a comic romp, but it had a very interesting premise that kept it watchable. There was some exposition to explain the world we were seeing that I thought was unneeded. But the lead actors, playing brothers in the film, were both likeable and we rooted for them. Haley Jackson as Medusa was breathtakingly gorgeous.

Looking at the poster and reading the description for Fighting Olympus made me figure this is a movie that my partner is going to enjoy more than me. Oh, was I wrong. This movie is not just a shoot 'em up action type feature (which it does well by the way). The story line is imaginative and involved and full of twists and turns I was not expecting. I won't give spoilers or plot twists but I liked the way the writer pointed to characters from ancient greek myths like Hades, Athena and Medusa. The actress who played Medusa was AMAZING in the role. She is perfect as the disfigured woman out for revenge. Lastly, I must give a big shout out to the stunt/choreography people. The hand-to-hand combat scenes are exciting and a lot of work must have gone into those fight scenes. Two thumbs up!!

Went in expecting just another action movie and was, instead, taken on a wild ride I wasn't expecting. Very imaginative with a very involved story line that kept me on the edge of my seat. Leslie A. Jones, who played Rucker, was excellent throughout. Indie films don't have the benefit of big studio money and technicians, so it makes it all the more distinctive that director Julian Vaughan Hampton created this film with the elements of a very large cast, many locations, and well-executed fight scenes. The locations were especially impressive both interior and exterior. I will keep him on my radar.

Every work of art should be judged based on the artist's intent and as a result I give JOINT CUSTODY a 9/10. It's a microbudget independent film that knows its audience. Bray Films, a family owned production company, gives it a "kitchen sink" approach similar to early Wayans Bros (family) projects. While there seems to be far too many characters to keep track of who is who, the almost anthology style of story telling maintains a solid through-line of relationships within a black community - wives, husbands, fathers, mothers, sons, and daughters - it's about how each and every one bump up against one another and try to get through their day to day life. The writing is solid in that each scene keeps the audience entertained and does an excellent job of leading to the next, but it still become quite confusing as to whose story you're trying to follow.
Go for It !!!

The storyline of the film is totally a mess. Unconvincing plots and poor arrangement of the events. Characters speak the local Taiwanese language that is not identical to their community (Mostly Hokkien instead of Hakka) Story begins in California but the actors and actresses don't look like ones (from accents to their temperament) Sometimes weird and awkward plots are intentionally inserted and you know the director attempts to make the audience laugh but in vain-you would get annoyed when seeing those plots. The director seems to promote Taiwanese culture by putting tons of elements such as food and traditional buildings in it, looking like eccentric Lonely Planet. The illogical story is broken into bits and parts and you wouldn't even want to make sense of it, for it is just the worst and most meaningless Taiwanese movie I have ever seen. In summary, as a Taiwanese audience, I would never suggest you buy a ticket to see this movie.

Ten stars because it was surprisingly moving and sweetly poignant for a CNY holiday film. The illegitimate Taiwanese-American grandson turning up with a crappy old bowl claiming to be the heir to the crazy rich Taiwanese family sounds a bit like Cinderella's ugly step sister coming forward with a dusty slipper after midnight (and after a complete makeover, I'm sorry if that sounds sexist).

Started with typical horror cringe beginning ended up being a masterful story telling of the flaws of Chinese feudal society that led to a family tragedy and the aftermath. Even as a horror fan, I was about to stop watching it for like half an hour everything felt so out place, plot seemed to be getting side tracked meaninglessly glad i didn' actually stop once you go through first half the later part would stitch these all together and you would love it. All in all very cleverly made, good acting, soundtrack i mean everything is relatively fine in "Chinese standard". A Good "horror" movie to watch.

Massive Santino fan here. Watching this just doesn't make me laugh the way his pods do. Of course stand up is a whole different ballgame than podcasting. Maybe there is a widening between funny podcasters vs funny stand up comics going on. Santino's a funny guy but I realized watching this he's just better off script than on script. That's not a bad thing. It's just a new trend in comedy. Still have huge respect for him. Lots of great jokes here (don't let the offended Trump fans on the thread fool you). It may be a bit watered down for Netflix, but I think I'll be sticking to the podcasts moving forward.

The film tries to be something like Disney from the 90s, but it doesn't come close to the quality and script. The story is very weak, the characters are all bland and not captivating, unfunny jokes, it's just that generic movie about the arrogant hero who learns from his mistakes. The only decent thing I saw about this film was the art style, which is beautiful (despite using that generic digital animation in the cut-out), but otherwise it's nothing worth your time unless you don't have something else to see. Not wanting to be negative against Brazilian animation, but I expected more from this film.

Big fan of him and Bobby; however, This special continues the trend of comedians specials being far worse than their ability to be funny on podcasts. That being said. Of those in the rogan sphere, Santino is a lot closer to someone like Segura in terms of on stage ability and joke writing, whereas theo, Delia, and distefano are closer to schaub. Tbh the only truly good or great specials I've seen in recent years (past 5ish? Are louis C. K., Segura, gillis, Normand, Chapelle, and norm. Granted I will still check in to bad friends and whiskey ginger but I no longer entertain the idea of seeing Santino live.

Like I once wrote before it's impossible to please everybody with humour as we all have a different sense of humour but rating this stand-up comedy with the lowest score possible is just ridiculous. It was my first show from Andrew Santino and it turned out to be promising. I will gladly look out for more of his shows. He's not afraid of bashing Biden and Trump, or any other politician, as they are all puppets and incompetent. Cheeseburger has some good jokes, but they're not constant enough to make it exceptionally good. Andrew Santino is a born raconteur, it's obvious he likes to entertain people, but some parts of his show are sometimes a bit long before the jokes come. That's the only negative thing I found about this particular show. I definitely like his sense of humour, maybe a bit borderline to some but not to me as I like it raw and over the top. You have to be allowed of laughing at anything, that's what humour is about, no matter if you offend others or not. You just can't please everyone and that's fine.
The man looks like a cross between Bill Burr and Robin Williams. And it was not a waste of time to watch this special. I particularly enjoyed the "ocean big, straw float, turtle swim" bit.
Never seen his standup before. Love his podcast and his performance on Dave.

I've seen Santino live several times. He's absolutely killed it when I've seen him. This, however... I have no idea what this is. This feels like the pumpkin spice latte of comedy specials. Generic, bland, about as "basic" as comedy can get. At not one point does this special ever pick up and grab you. Probably be more effective as background noise while you're doing housework than anything else. I feel like he has reached that level where he has attained some level of success, and now he thinks he doesn't have to try hard anymore. It's very clear in his writing and execution. Unfortunate when comics go this route.

I have been watching Andrew santino on podcasts for 3 years now, bad friends and his podcast whiskey ginger. If you like him on the podcast you will love this special. He is thought provoking, realistic and the vulgar santino we have all come to love. I feel like stand up comedy is an extension into peoples lives behind the camera and how wr all can relate to particular situstions or thoughts we have thst the comedian vocalizes, he nails that dycotomy. He never lets a joke run dry and hits his delivery on every punch line. I highly recommend the special and his podcadts, hes a creative genius and seems like a dude you could defintely drink whiskey and play some pool with.

I am not very familiar with Andrew Santino, or his work. He appears to be a charming, decent guy. The issue is that he is just not that funny. It is not that he is offensive, or too esoteric. He covers a variety of topics, from the pandemic to sexuality to growing up in the 80's. His delivery is natural. His jokes and storytelling might be ok if he was a friend of yours, but not enough to conquer a Live audience. One of the other issues with the special is that he is also the Director and it is not shot very well. The special keeps going back and forth between two camera angles and it it a little distracting. I like Netflix comedy and try them all. This was very average, at best.

Funny, funny, funny and some. Let me start off saying my wife and I are huge comedy fans. We have seen a ton of comedians including some of the greats. Carlin, Pryor, Mooney, also Mencia, Murphy, and Raphi May to name a few. I really didn't know what to expect and being a fan one cold morning I took the plunge. Love him really loved his style, honesty, timing was off the hook and more importantly Mr. Santino was fearless with a wit to match. Political, current, against the grain and soul searching his show had it all in a time when a older generation but very small minority of people want to censor free speech. This guy like Bill Burr is here to stay. Loved it and I highly recommend watching his show.

This was absolutely terrible, what a snooze fest, I fell asleep halfway through it and had to finish the next day it was so boring. There wasnt a single joke that made me laugh. I can't think of one original bit, everything Santino said in this special has already been said in a funnier way by a previous comic. Covid, Prostate exam, global warming etc.... All of it was HACK. If you found this good, I am extremely jealous as you've obviously never seen good comedy and have a lot left to discover. This is on par with Whitney Cummings and Brendan Schaubs latest specials. If I were Santino I would stick to reading ads and doing podcasts.

Cheeto Santino has created not just one of the greatest closing bits ever but what I think of in the same way I do of Gary Gulman's bit about the documentary he watched about the people that shortened the State's names - and has a great similarity.

Have always been a casual fan of Andrew and used to listen to his podcast fairly regularly (Bad Friends). Haven't really followed him much the past year or so but figured I'd give his special a try after a few rips. About 50% of the way through and I'm honestly not sure what happened to him either before or during the writing process, was he hit in the head by a crazy homeless person? Did he switch bodies with Amy Schumer only while writing jokes? Did someone force him to tell unfunny bits for the first half and save the actual comedy for the second? SOMEONE PLEASE EXPLAIN WHY IT'S SO BAD. Best of luck Andrew, great to see you atleast still have a semi-successful podcast.

I thoroughly enjoyed Andrew's special and particularly loved the message behind it. Cheeseburger might not be for everyone, but you can probably say that about any special. Those who are fans of Whiskey Ginger or Bad Friends will especially love this special. He covers a barrier of topics, all of which I thought he was able to convey in a very funny way that kept me hooked in throughout the hour long special.
The very first line out of this "comics" mouth was about the anti Vaxers. Immediately no. I've seen what I needed to see, immediately no.
First off this was a great special lots of laughs. I think people that give this anything below a 6 either didn't watch the whole special or just can't handle comedy.

Not only is he not funny but he is literally advocating for the murdering of a US president. I don't care which side of the aisle you are on that was completely not funny. It seems even the audience was forced to play along with his horrible jokes. I used the term jokes but they really weren't even that. The best way to sum it up is that I want my time back. This review thing is literally making me write 240 more characters so I guess I'm just going to Babylon until the time is on. Now I'm down to 126 118 106 9894 I don't know how long this will have to go before it'll be done. I'm almost there now it'll finally let me submit.
He is able to walk a very fine line that we haven't seen since early early stages of David Chapel.

This guy thinks he is hilarious and edgy but he is anything but. What a mess from start to finish. I watched with two of my friends... one of which watches his podcast with Bobby Lee on YouTube. Even He was visibly cringing throughout. This guy just isn't funny. He wants to be. He thinks he is. He's not. It was sad to watch and the only redeeming factor was that we got a good laugh at his expense by roasting how awkward and strange this man is. If you want to watch it, watch it... but don't be surprised if you are left feeling sorry for the guy. Why do so many comedians these days take themselves so seriously??? It's like they think they are the only people on the planet capable of being funny. Off-putting and odd. I didn't enjoy any of his "comedy" and he seemed very afraid of getting canceled which was a little cringeworthy but honestly funny because I don't think he could even be canceled, considering nobody knows who he is. Just outright weird.

This guy is a viewers nightmare as he is lazy and delivers his audience a clamshell full of cancel cultlure let me fit it with the woke crowd to be accepted antics - complete leftists nonsense wrapped up as comedy.....in one of his "observations" he advocates for killing a president - If you simply replace the word Trump with Obama would this have caused any sort of outrage in the media on advocating to kill a president? Does that really pass as a joke? I really feel that we no longer have comedians they only want to be accepted by what they perceive as the in the crowd - do yourself a favor skip this and go back in time to find actual stand up comedy.

This whole special feels like Santino was angry and drunk when he wrote it. Cheeseburger really is a comedy set that is divided into two parts. The first half is hyper focused on politics. It's fatal flaw is Santino can't help but parade his West Coast elite mentality around. As a comedian he should know how badly this alienates half his audience. The second half of the set detours slightly and becomes way too preachy, focusing more on Santino's personal views while being thin on jokes. There is one massive five minute setup for a single joke to land come the end. As someone who occasionally watches highlights of the Bad Friends podcast with Santino and Bobby Lee, I was expecting more out of Santino than this...

Stumbling upon the 2023 stand-up comedy special "Andrew Santino: Cheeseburger" while perusing through the Netflix catalogue of stand-up comedy, I opted to sit down and watch this on account of never having heard about comedian Andrew Santino before. So of course I wanted to check out his style of comedy.

I love Andrew on Bad Friends and I know he's a funny guy, but this was just awful. I did not laugh once. I've seen comedy live a few times and I know it's always better in person but this was an absolute snooze fest. This was the most sterile, middle of the road, "I have all the right opinions but I can sort of, kind of, maybe see the other side...right? Guys....right?". If this is what comedy has become I am very sad about it. I've loved standup comedy my entire life but this just put a bad taste in my mouth like I was watching Disney destroy Star Wars all over again. Santino you're better than this. What was this material. Even the audience barely laughed. Props for not adding in fake laughter I suppose but the reality is there were so few punchlines or jokes that it really wouldn't have made a difference.

"Chef Jack: O Cozinheiro Aventureiro", a Brazilian animated film, doesn't quite hit the mark in several important aspects. Directed by Guilherme FiÃºza Zenha, Artur Costa, and Carlos Daniel, it tries to mix humor and adventure in a cooking-themed setting, but often falls short.

This is suspense drama film with brilliantly directed by Dushyant Pratap Singh as till last of the film u won't come to know anything as that tight scriptted story it is which is good for audience point of view & with beautiful songs done by Music composer like Anjjan Bhattacharya who did song " badnaam na kar dena" in this movie & who have many previous hits songs in his name & lyricist of this song is kumaar who have written many superhit songs prevoiusly & another composer Indrani Bhatterjee who did brilliant song with Daler Mehndi & it's very grovy kind of song to dance & artist like Hiten Tejwani & Hemant Pandey & other artist also did wonderful job as it came out so natural all their performances so this movie surely recommended to see.
A fun adventure movie with a dash of comedy. There are plenty of twists and turns that keep the movie ticking along but the run time was a tad short.
Awesome Director by Dushyant Pratap Singh. It's family drama with lots of suspense & beautiful songs & performances by artist. Awesome act by hiten tejwani, rajkumr kanojiya and hemant pandey.

This is Zhang Yuan's best film so far. Granted he is known mostly as a singer, this film shows a different side of him and proof that he can carry his own in acting. Liu Yase is wonderful in this film. Given that she won the Hong Kong Film Award for best actress, I expected nothing less.

I was not expecting this to be any good, considering it's done by Youku; however I was greatly impressed with this movie, I found myself laughing and appreciating the actions, the sets, the acting and the vibrant colors.

title: A Alegria Ã© a Prova dos Nove

review_text: He definition of a popcorn film is a movie that you would only watched once but still enjoyable. EVA is a popcorn movie. I like the storyline, death etc. But here's the problem with EVA... SHAMSUL ACTING ARE SO FRICKIN' BAD! I literally cringed when I saw Shamsul acting. Yes, it's his first time. But it's so bad, that I think even a random 6 years old can do better.. Besides Shamsul acting, Nadia Aqilah acting are so good. I'm glad I could see her acting again. Last film I see her was "Renjana". Also very great cameos like Nam Ron, Tony Eusoff. And let's not forget the cinematography I love it. So I will give EVA 7 stars...

The writers and directors who produced this movie is not a person who aspires for peace. The movie features senseless violence and honestly I think it should be banned. The movie is not original at all. I don't know what else to say about it. I have seen a lot of movies on the same topic as well and it was more interesting. The writers and directors are not familiar with the subject of their own films. The actors do not have the talent and skills necessary to be considered for Hollywood. The movie is not popular and unfortunately I don't think it's worth the time and effort to watch the movie.

title: Here It's a Bed of Roses

review_text: One of the best punjabi movies I've seen in my life It's totally worth your time and the music of rang ishqay da is the heart of this movie. Every situation has a perfect song. Ok so let's talk about actors performance and the good thing about this movie is that they given the chance to new actors Ali Abbas Syed,Amna Rahi,Zariya Khan did very well job Iftikhar Thakur sir is our legendary actor In the movie Ifthikhar Thakur did his best in the movie. In the negative roles Wahaj Khan Achhi Khan totally nailed their characters. As a psycho villain Waseem Ali also did very good job. Last but not least Madiha shah and Nagma begum also did excellent job My recommendation is that you should watch this movie with family .

Ancient secrets and bloody events concealed within the landscape. Remote communities that still follow the old ways. Witchfinders. Slightly arrogant antiquarians. Rural churches with crumbling graveyards. Isolated coastal villages. Landscapes that can be both beautiful to look at but eerie to tread in after dark. This anthology has all the classic Folk Horror elements that many of us have come to love and actively seek out in our viewing and reading. So if you're into FH give it a watch. Shades of MR James and BBC's Ghost Stories for Christmas. It's obviously a low budget production but that only adds to the charm.

We just saw "Here it's a bed of roses" (what a long title btw) last night, and we are still trying to figure out Burcin. He is like that mysterious student in class who you're kind of drawn to, but you're also a little afraid to make eye contact, you know? The whole vibe was very Film Studies 101, which we loved. We also liked the minimal music and sound usage. Dream scenes were interesting... The pacing could be more tightened though. I loved the part where the protagonist totally loses it on the balcony -- it was weirdly intense! Overall, I think it is a successful and interesting first film.

I stumbled upon this film at a festival, and to my delight, its story has lingered in my mind long after the credits rolled. It's a reminder of the core teachings in scriptwriting classes: character, character, character. The movie shines where it counts-its characters are relatable and their journeys resonate deeply.
My first thought when I started watching this was... Geez, this is bad.

First of all, I have to correct the angry 1 star reviewer by pointing out that the title is a play on "Enter the Fat Dragon", not Enter the Dragon. Of course, they seemed to have a chip on their shoulder going in, so I'm sure it won't matter.
This was the first time I had ever asked for a refund for a movie ticket. I've seen straight to DVD releases that were much better.

Definitely a fun watch!! Filmed, written, and created in and around the Ottawa region, this film is a love letter to the area, to film, and to the exploitation genres. Don't take yourself or the movie too seriously. Watch with zero expectations and see what can be created with a whole lot of heart, dedication, creativity, and zero budget. This movie has everything ... action, adventure, romance, drama, mystery, songs, kung-fu, drag queens, drag kings, zombies, lots of c*cks, a splash of sequins, and some quality special effects!! As a resident of Ottawa it was so much fun to see in the Mayfair Theatre and cheer along at the sight of Ottawa monuments and root for the good guys.

This is an example of what can be achieved by a talented Director (check out the Numbers) and a solid ensemble cast on a modest budget. This is brilliantly beautiful filmmaking which moved along at a rapid pace making you wonder where the time went. The stories based around the Great War are intertwined yet equally satisfying. The characters including Old Dice, Captain Sinclair and the bookseller all give mesmerising performances. The film pulls of some great comedy gags which is no mean feat in the world of independent filmmaking. This is a true labour of love from a history loving director. Check it out!

The film did an excellent job of systematically reviewing how Disney have broken trust with parents and families by promoting social causes and sexuality in kids' programs and movies. The documentary has interviews by a diverse set of political, entertainment, and social experts. The documentary features analysis by experts who discussed the changes at Walt Disney World of the formerly family-friendly brand. The documentary also showed the effects on Disney's movies and push for social change on children.

For anyone with a small knowledge of WW1, the soldiers who fought and the Edwardian supernatural/mystic/weird era (Kipling, Conan-Doyle, HG Wells), this is a brilliant portrayal of the real horror of the trenches. Evocative, humorous (don't you know who I am on the telephone?) military and other gags. Watch and listen carefully for the humour. You're drawn into the brutal and recent, very good "It's all quiet on the Western Front" story of young men and 1916 British conscripts/volunteers (follow the pointing Kitchener finger!). The horror in the minds of the men in the mud we'll never know. This film provides an insight into their thinking.

The Plot:
The film investigates how Disney promotes social causes and sexuality in kids' content. It features analysis by experts on the politics of the formerly family-friendly brand and the effects on children.

This richly-observed documentary by Jens Meurer captures the eccentricity and independence of Cromer, the rebel edge of England. Using the end of the pier show to hold together its interweaved biographical stories, it provides an emotional, sometimes weird survey of the politics of leaving the EU, spliced together with the production of a summertime special.

Great acting, a nice story and excellent execution. And very relatable. Some very prominent social issues of our times are woven into the structure of the story. The loneliness even amidst endless social media consumption and participation, the stigma of seemingly age-inappropriate behaviour, the desire to live and love despite all odds, complicated filial relatuonships, it's all in there.
How often do you watch a good movie in a theatre? Quite often right? Ok let me rephrase the question, how often do you watch a good BENGALI movie in a theatre? See? Got you!
DILKHUSH is the rare movie that succeeds on almost every level, where each character, scene, costume, and joke firing on all cylinders to make a film worth repeated viewings.

Perfect wedding is rather caricatured example of a cinematographic failure. There is rather no direction. Chaos creating a tangle of scenes that seem to have no beginning or end. The dialogues are full of attempts at humor, but they turn out to be completely unfunny and even pathetic, making the audience feel embarrassed instead of amused. Overall, this film is an example of how not to make cinema, it is not only a failed work, but an even tiresome experience for anyone who decides to watch it. We had to scroll to quickly go through this devoid of flair series. Waste of time. I rarely write reviews but had to share my bad experience on this one.
You folks must be doing some serious drugs... smh.

This was an interesting anthology mainly because of its seamless transitions between shorts. Some shorts were better than others, as were the performances and sound quality. You can tell the shorts we're done over different times, some of them were even 48 hour films.

Saw Eric Robert's name and said to myself "how bad can it be". 120 minute movie that should have been a 15 minute Dust short on you tube. Avoid this movie Unless you are a film student and need to write a paper on how to make a really bad movie.

I'm not sure how this possibly won a single award. There must have been no other submissions. I'm it sure if it is the dry dead community theatre acting, or the terrible visual effects, the lame sound effects, the cheesy writing... it was bad y'all. How did these people convince Eric Roberts to use his floating head? I'm not even sure drug use would improve this movie, but I'm certain the writer was possibly using subpar psychedelics when he wrote "kill them, there is no such thing as death" Jason, how can you kill someone if death is fake? I have insomnia, I was hoping this would bore me to sleep, but I was horrified thinking, how did I end up here? Was watching early 2000's sci-fi and now this? So bad.
When I saw Eric Roberts in the cast, I felt it may have been worth the risk to watch. This is 120 minutes of mush.

Yeah, I thought maybe I was missing the point when I kept jumping forward looking desperately for a plot, or moral, or something, anything I could relate to. It's just not there. This is an empty room with boring pictures.

Except possibly for some of the early soundtrack, this film is awful. That's A. W. F. U. L., in EVERY respect. Twilight Zone episodes are FAR better--more gripping, more entertaining, and infinitely more comprehensible! Much of the editing is simply jarring and, ultimately annoying, and does nothing to serve a storyline, or create or enhance a mood. The disembodied, floating head of victor is FAR surpassed by the wizard's head in The Wizard of Oz. The director seems to be trying to leap-frog off of 'Solaris' (1972 (russian Solyaris) and 2002 remake starring george clooney). Indeed, virtually all of the 'effects' are just way better in thousands of other films, sci-fi or otherwise. Towards the end i asked my wife to turn the dam*ed thing off. She replied that there were only 20 minutes left; it has to be one of the most wasted 20 minutes of my entire 70+ years. Maybe if you're heavily stoned or on an acid trip, this film could make you roll with mocking laughter. Really, do not bother with this one.

title: La plus belle pour aller danser
Brick by Brick: The Story of Wrigley Field

review_text: Saw this back at the 2023 Sundance Film Festival.

title: Kung Fu Leeuw
roles: Kung fu trainer & lion dance musician

review_text: This is the absolute worst movie I've ever seen. I was laughing so hard the entire movie. I would rather watch doll shark and transmutators which is really saying something. The acting was non existent and I've seen puppet movies with better effects than this. This movies budget must have been ATLEAST 2000 dollars. It was so bad. I do not recommend in any way at all. Please never watch anything related in any way shape or form of anybody who took place is this movie. I would kill myself than take place in this movie. So to anybody scrolling through IMDb for cheesy movies I am begging you on my knees please never ever in your whole life watch this movie unless you're looking for some good laughs. Whoever I would the phillipianian classic Transmutators. Also a good laugh.
"Big Freakin' Snakes," a film that dares to defy the norms of conventional cinema and emerges as a unique gem. This movie doesn't just push boundaries; it slithers over them with grace.

I couldn't agree more! Big snakes definitely add an extra thrill to a monster movie. The film's cast did a fantastic job bringing the story to life, adding depth and excitement to their characters. The cinematography exceeded expectations, capturing the scale and intensity of the snakes in a visually stunning way. It's impressive how the filmmakers managed to create such captivating visuals within their budget. The special effects further enhanced the excitement, making the snake encounters truly thrilling. Overall, this film delivers a fun and entertaining experience for fans of monster movies, and it's definitely worth watching for its great cast, impressive cinematography, and exciting effects.
Straight to the point...
Saw this at the 2023 Sundance Film Festival.

Food and Country was well-received at the SXSW Film Festival. It is an extremely well-research documentary that explores the nature of food production and distribution within US capitalist system. The film uses cases studies of smaller independent farmers, ranchers, fisherman and restauranteurs to explore the complexities of our food system. It shows how our system was structured historically to gradually consolidate food production into a oligopoly of large producers who are able to mass produce inexpensive food.
Nuanced and heartfelt, this is an arthouse indie type that doesn't mind taking its time.
Watched it at the local film festival in Spain.

This movie explores a marriage in decline, where love has vanished but commitment endures. Both husband and wife, despite being on opposite ends of the conflict, are likable. The film lacks a sense of amusement; there isn't a traditional climax and resolution. Still, dedicated to portraying a declining relationship authentically, it achieves its objective effectively. The movie poses profound questions and paints a vivid picture of human relationships, occasionally leaving certain plot threads unresolved. This deliberate ambiguity may frustrate some viewers seeking closure, but it serves to encourage further contemplation and interpretation of the film's themes.

I'll preface this by saying that I am brand loyal to Asics; their shoes got me through my first marathon 5 years ago and since then I've only purchased Asics clothing. The fact that this documentary was produced by Asics was the main reason I watched it so I was prepared for a glorified advert, which is not my issue with the film.
Super interesting and a different motivation to exercise!

If you're used to snooze-inducing documentaries, then be prepared to experience the opposite effect! Mind Games - The Experiment will have you reaching for your running shoes, inspired to get up, go out, and exercise more.

I loved the concept, which resonated loudly with me. As one that is allergic to 'physical sport' & actually any proactive exercise, and has geek & nerd tendencies in abundance, this piqued my interest. More than that, it's actually got me moving a bit.

I really loved this film, in fact more of a documentary highlighting a quite unknown fact: the beneficial effects of sport activities on the brain and cognitive skills of humans. Also fun and easy to follow, I highly recommend to watch it on Amazon prime. Through the lens of different people, we see the evolution and the perseverance that more physical activity gives them. Fortunately no fake marketing but a well done production, especially for a quite small budget, this film is really not boring for a second. It actually conveys really well the values of a sound mind in a sound body which is a beautiful morality.

Is exercise good for your mind as well as your body?. Can exercise actually boost your cognitive function to give you the edge in competition? Beautifully narrated by, national treasure, Stephen Fry, this topic is explored with the help of some very talented, but self confessed couch potatoes. From gamers to chess players you are introduced to the participants of the experiment. All are hoping that starting to exercise can give them a shot of progressing to the next level of their chosen mind games. You are soon rooting for these people and hoping all their hard work pays off. How does it go? I wouldn't want to spoil it for you would I? Watch it now, you won't regret it!

Bangladesh Film Industry start a fresh and warming Year through The Big budget Action based film 'Black War: Mission Extreme 2'. It's a sequel Of 2021 release 'Mission Extreme'.. First part was a little bit disappointing. After watching that part most People were disappointed and not that much interested with this second & last part. But after watching last Friday release 'Black war: Mission Extreme 2' i can say and assure that it's a sigh of relief. This part definitely lives up to the less expectations. All The Credit goes to Director Duo Sunny Sanwar & Faisal Ahmed & Their Team. But Most important Thing of this cop thriller was One & only Actor Arifin Shuvoo. His improved acting skill, body language, look and tremendous dedication for this movie was top notch. With Arifin Shuvoo actress sadia nabila was recognise for her wonderful screen presence. Along with them sumit sengupta, Taskeen Rahman, Fazlur Rahman Babu also make a mark.

title: These Two Hands - The Story of Bowen Therapy

review_text: Blind Blood has tension and mystery running through its veins. As things develop more is revealed and the tense scenes never let up.

No spoiler review
The First Mission extreme was So Bad But This Sequal is Surprisingly Good
I Think It is By Far The Best Bangladesh Action Movie so Far..
Despite The Story is linear AF
The action Is Great
The Vfx is actually a Improvement and The Characters have soul Putting Acting This Time..its a Great Start For dhallywood In 2023..Hope we Got A a more Better Movies and Hope This Industry Lastly Will shine after the Many Years Of Being In Tunnel
respect Shuvo For His Work and I dont want It To he A Flop do Everyone Who were disappointed With First One should watch This One As This Is actually Awesome movie.

The people who were disappointed with the first part of the franchise can have a sigh of relief cause second part lives up to the expectations. Thanks to Arifin Shuvoo's tremendous dedication and also direction of Sunny Sanwar & Faisal Ahmed. Having said that, there were flaws in the film as well.

"Black War: Mission Extreme -2" is an utterly disappointing and forgettable action movie. From start to finish, it fails to deliver any semblance of quality or originality, leaving the audience feeling cheated and uninspired.

NGL i didnt have that much expections from this sequal as i was dissapointed seeing Mission extreme but oh my deed. This one is actually good and theres alot of improvements. First the actions scenes are is there alot and its decent made but fun to watch. The acting is great this time and The songs which one is "Ma" and anoher one "Guli maro" or whatever. So ma song is good but the guli maro one is unnessary and undone. Moving on, The story is really thrilling this time and anyone will understand it. The VFX are average but better than first one . The ending in this one is alot time better than the first one. In the end faisal ahmed and sunny sanwar lastly got what they should have done right. Its a great movie and props to faisal ahmed and sunny sanwar for making one of the best Bangladeshi action movie.

Michael Marco's direction in this crime thriller keeps you in each scene and in each frame. The tone of the photography is in keeping with the tone of the movie. Marco works both sides of the camera, besides his role as writer, director, producer.

Blind Blood follows Texas gunslingers as they navigate a brutal world of violence, revenge, and lawless schemes. The film delivers superb storytelling that keeps you hooked from start to finish, blending gritty action with an oddly sharp sense of humor reminiscent of Reservoir Dogs. The characters are memorable, the dialogue crackles with energy, and the tension never lets up. It's a bold, stylish, and thoroughly entertaining ride through the darker corners of modern-day Texas. Phenomenal flick!

I'm not one for leaving reviews to be honest. But this one certainly deserved it. I'm not only a fan of this genre but I myself am also an independent filmmaker. So when I stumbled upon BLIND BLOOD I was skeptical. These films are not as easy to make with a low budget. But Michael Marco found a way. He is the Writer, Producer, Director and he performed in the film. A lead role no less.

These Two Hands is one of the most inspiring documentaries I've ever seen. It beautifully tells the story of Bowen Therapy - not just as a healing technique, but as a gift of compassion, intuition, and human touch. The film takes you on a heartfelt journey through the legacy of Tom Bowen and the people whose lives have been transformed by his work.

An endearing and true life story about Tom Bowen, the humble Bowen Therapist in Geelong- Victoria. Who transformed peoples lives with his gentle touch. Often helping and sometimes healing people that thought there was no relief from their pain. Inspirational in his ability to take care, open his doors to so many, with his own-knowing way to help people to heal. You will laugh, cry and be touched by this beautifully amazing, unsung Australian legend's tale.

Caught the film at the 28th IFFK where the Director stood around for a QnA session where he said the above sentence of a film on Buenos Aires, older people, interpretive dance, flamingos and flooding. Even if one does not connect with the story, it's still a feast of visuals and sound. No shot or foley is wasted. Definitely check it out if you appreciate a subversion of the detective story a la 'Decision to Leave' and films that aren't meant to be taken literally.

The recently released Marathi film, 'Sarla Ek Koti', is a must-watch for all cinema lovers. The film boasts of a powerful storyline that delves into the complexities of human relationships and the struggles of daily life. The director has done a remarkable job in capturing the essence of rural Maharashtra and the lead actors have brought the characters to life with their outstanding performances.

Marco e Giulia attempts to delve into the unexpected twists of life with a comedic lens, but unfortunately, it falls flat. Directed by Fabio De Luigi, the film boasts a talented cast that is regrettably underutilized. The premise had potential, yet the execution is riddled with clichÃ©s, offering little in terms of originality or emotional depth.

They had a capacity to put this "short flick" on the Japanese movie theaters for a very short limited time. Aiming for making cash because Japan have the most loyal consumers of the Quuen in the globe I bit this bait without realizing that have ONLY one hour length! Not enough, Freddy old footage is not remasterized (except one cut) so watching this old analog stretched 480p (or worse) quality on the big cinema screen was really awful in every aspect.

title: NÃ£o Sou Nada - The Nothingness Club

review_text: Spooky college stuns you from the get go, the horror, thrills and a haunted college setting makes the entire film watchable multiple times. Having watched it twice makes you feel there are more hidden clues to be discovered through the film. The films clever writing and on screen presence of all characters play a vital part in getting spooked through the film. The film also seamlessly integrates the sound design, edit and vfx for a lovely storytelling experience. The film does a solid 1st half and equally midblowing 2nd half. Kudos to the cinematographer, editor, director and vfx for bringing this to us. In total this is a complete entertainer in the horror genre.

Movie is technically sound, the making is top notch no compromise in the making the music and bgm are too good. The movie basically deals with psychological horror and thriller content with gripping second half and best 20 mins climax in a movie. Vivek Simha's and Kushi Ravi's elegance steals the show. A production house like Sridevi Entertainers, for them Quality matters over Quantity they have produced 3 movies so far which have been a huge success in Sandalwood industry. The makers have not at all compromised in making the movie you can surely see that in the movie the execution or cinematography everything are top notch.

Superb movie,good direction and vivek acting is suberb. Debut director made it well. The key ingredients that make a movie "good" are when the acting, directing, writing, cinematography, and overall production value all come together to tell one cohesive, entertaining, and impactful story. In essence, a good movie uses all these tools of filmmaking to tell a compelling story that makes you feel.at the end it was a thriller suspence.that was a really good movie," "I was not expecting it to be that good," and "I'm so glad I took the time to see this." These work well to share your admiration for the movie or the way it made you feel while watching it.

Making of the movie Is top notch., vivek and kushee.steals everyone's heart by their fantastic acting. 2nd of the movie Is completely thrilling ,and keeps the viewers much more excited. Songs and bgm of the movie Is great and great work my the production house .the product house has not been compramised in any cases and I believe that's the main reason for this beautiful making of the complete movie . Vivek and kushi have played their role so well ,the best thing of the movie was the climax ,I didn't expect that twist at the end ,overall great work by the entire team of spooky College. Must watch movie of the year ..

We're always excited anytime Jade drops a movie as she has a brilliant mind and values quality. Somehow The Trade wasn't her style. The film had a good initiative but couldn't stand up straight due to the misused cast and inadequate screenplay
Let's talk about "The Trade" a recent Nigerian movie you probably didn't notice.
Omo, the casts all played their roles very well!

I just got to watch this, I guess the marketing could have been better. Despite my relative late viewing, it kept me up and engaged all night. The acting of the main character Blossom Chukwujekwu aka Erik was amazing. The story line delved into an issue that needed to be brought to light. Amazing cast. I hope this movie gets it deserved flowers.

Pleasantly surprised by this crime thriller that is set in the kidnap for ransom underworld. Blossom shines through as the charismatic lead supported by a cast of heavy hitters and newer faces come together to make the third act worth it. The story is one that isn't foreign to the nigerian experience with highlights of culture and religion in the background. Stan Nze and Shawn Faqua continue to show their versatility and Ali Nuhu gives an award-worthy understated performance as a relatable police investigator. The large cast is really good, the suspense feels real and the pacing was just right. My one problem was that with a couple of characters the accents were a bit inconsistent and sometimes too exaggerated. I don't think that was helpful.
Excellent movie! We all had an idea of how the movie will end but the execution was top notch. Very good acting (down to the accents and mannerisms of the area) by everyone.

Jadesola, your brilliance as a director is truly exceptional. Your wealth of experience places you firmly among the elite in African cinema. I have no doubt that this remarkable movie has the potential to earn you well-deserved nominations and awards this year.

KSI: In Real Life (2023) is a documentary following the YouTuber, boxer, and musician, KSI. It details his rise to fame and the issues that come alongside it. As a documentary, the film doesn't keep a consistent pacing and feels quite unorganised at times. However, I found JJ to be interesting and I enjoyed learning about his life.

As with just about 90% of the UK who watched YouTube in their younger years, KSI was a prominent part of my daily life. We grew alongside him, and became men and women of the world as he did. It's so refreshing to see someone who I thought must think the world is in the palm of his hand going through life, going through struggles and going through pain, really hit home.

Who is this documentary for? I am sure that the majority of the people who watch this are fans who love KSI and everyone around him, I myself have watched him since before the Sidemen. But the documentary really doesn't explain nor teach many unknown parts of JJs life. We learn that his motivation is money and spite, how charming. This philosophy on life is flawed. But if you would watch this and don't have any idea who KSI is you would klick off directly.
One of the very few times i did not finish something before reviewing it. It took me only forty-three minutes to stop watching.
Self-involved, egomaniacal, shallow af. Not sure what vapid 10 yo's this was made for

I rated KSI: In Real Life a 9/10 because I'm a hardcore fan of KSI, and not because of the quality of the actual documentary. Honestly, I don't blame you for assuming this; half of the people who rated this probably rated it a 10 or 1 because they love or hate KSI. I can assure you that I gave KSI: In Real Life a 10 because this documentary deserves it. Why? Mainly because of the parts in it about KSI's family. Don't get me wrong, the rest of the documentary was hilarious, and fascinatingly made me realize the type of person KSI is; not the good stuff I already knew, but the flaws. However, they can't compare to the parts about his family that hit home. Every time family was mentioned I could feel the water in my eyes trying to break free. I told myself as I watched: "I ain't crying in no documentary." I could not let a documentary be the 5th movie I've cried in out of 300+. But once JJ broke down, I did too. And I'm not talking about a tiny droplet that pushed its way just outside my eye, I'm talking about full on tears that went to my chin. Out of those 5 movies I've cried in, I had never cried as much as I did this time. The only reason this isn't a 10/10 is because most of the movie doesn't have an intense emotion, but the parts that do are sensational. In conclusion, if you are an old or new fan of KSI, watch this through to the end, for if you've never cried in a film, this could be your first.

This film is just about the worst documentary ever made. Hell, Ed Woods might have directed it himself. It's basically a cheap attempt to do Dwayne THE ROCK Johnson's "Young Rock" but with a guy with zero talent who got lucky the current generation has no taste in celebrity nor idols.

This movie is a recording of the truth around us, narrated in a neutral tone. Though it breaks our heart to watch the scenes, it is a must watch, for all Indians who want to be aware and are interested in creating a better country and a better world...
Especially the younger generation who are the future earth citizens. High time we and they came out of the traditional beliefs that the cow is our mother (buffaloe?). All the dairy based industries use more of buffaloes milk, but no one knows this. Thats not the point here though. The point is our sense of justice and fairness which we seem to have lost somewhere on the way in our evolution, and watching this film with an open mind might help in making informed decisions which will go a long way towards that better world.
Nothing in this movie made sense. Very little horror element and all of it is in trailer. Very disappointed. Do not watch this.
