What a movie! What an acting! What a music! My God .. Unbelievable movie. Dear Director...You are the best. Super-duper movie. I can watch this movie 1000 times without any second thought. Darsheel .. You are a darling. You would be a great actor in future .. Keep ip your good work. Please spread the msg given in the movie. Every parents should watch this to take care of their child career in the right path. Heart Touching story Line..Never Ending Story...Great Music and each and eavry character in the movie played their role in the perfect way. Please accept my greetings and Love for this Move. Great Job..Good Work and Congratulations!
_Ho ja Mukta_ is a heartfelt movie directed by Sumeeth Nagdev. The movie cleverly follows a young Vicky who struggles with anxiety and depression.
This review is from an American perspective.
Actually it was REALLY GOOD - I do recommend you watch until the end. The acting of some is iffy. But the main characters are great actors. Very believable and not overtly exaggerated.

From the opening scene you know you're in for a treat with this film. The main actor Andrew Jacob Brown steals every scene that he's in. The writing in this film is done so well and the seeds are laid perfectly for the big finale.
Elie is a decetive who wants dispetaly want to find and save his ex partner. He gets obessivd over the case like any good cop would. Except Eli to has some saving to do in himself.

No pun intended - although it makes me think: did Schrodinger account the nine lives cats have? So it would be more likely that the cat is alive when we finally decide to open the box. Anyway, no cat in a box here ... but catnip in a box. Is that better? Tough to say - you decide. Also if you want to watch something as silly and weird as this - with the one life you have.

I almost switched off - until I didn't - when I realised the two mismatched protagonists bore similarities to R2-D2 and the other one, and when a mercenary type mystery lady entered the play - this no budget, comedy, martial arts adventure suddenly ascended to 'trash cinema classic' status. Comic book violence, restrained set shots and a much grander plot than the budget affords, I liked it and laughed out loud as was intended.
I had the opportunity to see "Mad Cats" at the Brussels International Film Festival in April 2023.

Following the theft of mythical catnip, two bunglingly ineffectual male protagonists, and a kawaii kung fu goddess undertake an increasingly eccentric odyssey, wherein a brutal gang of vengeful anthropomorphic cats aggressively attempt to reclaim this ancient Egyptian bounty! Absurdist, blissfully silly, briskly violent and brilliantly entertaining, Tsuno's playfully paradigm-shifting action comedy caught me wholly by surprise. Cuddlesome, and most deadly, Mad Cats is a winningly whimsical actioner that is bound to have friskier film lover's feline fine!
Saw this at the 2023 Sundance Film Festival

I have seen Last Things at Docaviv film festival. Deborah's work truly pushes the genre boundaries of documentary cinema. This is an existentialist parable based on the theory of mineral evolution, an exciting mix of documentary and science fiction. Through transcending the conventions of science documentaries, Deborah achieves an effect that is so lacking in the most thoughtful films about space and the origin of life - Last Things produces a defamiliarization not just of human condition, but of the very nature of life and matter. In this sense, Deborah's work is the one documentary I have been looking for for a very long time! Furthermore, the visual merits of the work as well deserve to be highlighted - thus, the science of mineralogy appears as a truly exciting subjec which is the way in which mineralogy is very rarely described in general (no offense to mineralogists)
I am very happy to share my experiance with this movie. I can recommend this move 10/10. I believe, these are the best cast currently active in Sri Lankan cinema industry.

This movie was painfully awful to watch. The acting is forced and amateurish, particularly the performance by the writer/director. I've seen better acting at high school stage productions. The script meanders and drags along, taking its time then suddenly fast forwards a year. Some scenes go on for far too long. The direction and cinematography is also very amateurish - eye lines rarely match up when cutting from shot to shot. The music often feels completely out of place, too. The movie runs just under 90 minutes, but feels like at least twice that length. Avoid this at all costs. I am not joking.

I'm not sure if this was a home video, amateur actor promo film, but it certainly felt like it! The script and performances were so bad, it felt like an amateur dramatic society's B cast. It had so much potential but sadly the horses and scenery couldn't improve the film. I am surprised such dross was on prime to be honest.
I loved it. Was not a polished Hollywood film! However, very refreshing in its style, acting and cinematography. Stephen Spielberg, George Clooney and Brad Pitt were obviously not involved.

"First Snow Of Summer" would be best described as a romantic fairy-tale for grown-ups that combines the imaginative world of Jean-Pierre Jeunet's AmÃ©lie or Delicatessen with Wes Anderson-like cinematography and colour palette. The romantic story evolves slowly yet steadily with its pleasant gentle soundtrack and a fantastical undertone. I actually didn't mind that the whole plot was far-fetched and obviously impossible and not realistic, because from the beginning Chris Raiber, the director and screenwriter, didn't even try to convince us that this story should be taking place in the real world. I only wish we got to see some scenes that were more honest or straightforward in dialogue, because the characters mostly speak in metaphores or in a poetic manner - I would have loved to see some rawer or more naturalistic parts of the script for it would add some contrast to the whole narrative that otherwise feels a bit too uniform. But despite this I still think it is a nice spin on the romantic genre.

Anil Kumar Alla's Kalyanam Kamaneeyam is about an unemployed guy looking for a job but failing to find employment despite good qualifications. And how he is convinced to get married to his wife due to her mother being terminal and wanting to see her wedding. Despite, his wife supporting him initially, her boss passing bad comments about his work ethic causes her to suspect him and lose her faith in his sincerity. Then he needs to find a job to prove his sincerity.

Thursday morning, wife asks if we can go to the movies and sends the trailer of this movie. I watch only a few seconds and made up my mind. The lightning, composition and color were more than enough to give it a go.
First snow of summer could have followed suit to many movies in the same romance drama genere, in which we suffer as the main charcter's condition is worse daily!
Where Is the Lie? Is a thought-provoking film that dives into the world of online dating and the chaos of catfishing.

The film effectively explores themes of trust, deception, and the darker aspects of online relationships. The performances are compelling, particularly in how they portray the emotional and psychological impact of betrayal. While the premise may feel familiar, the film's execution is engaging and its exploration of identity and deception adds depth to the story. Overall, Where Is the Lie? Offers a gripping and insightful look into the complexities of modern romance and trust. The strong performances and the film's ability to provoke thought about the dangers of digital relationships make it a compelling watch. Despite some familiar plot elements, Where Is the Lie? Stands out with its intense storytelling and relevant social commentary.

I don't understand why the rating for this film is so low. I feel the story is so true, and so dramatic. The main character looks pretty. So gen-Z. It's so easy to be cheated online. As an observer, we always feel why that guy is so stupid, but actually not. It's hard to detect if they provided things that you're really eager for.

title: Love Beat the Hell Out of Me

review_text: Fantastically metatextual, witty, funny, sexy, irreverent and profound - a love letter to Shakespeare and theatre, and a startlingly deep-hitting piece about identity, societal roles, choices and family. Without spoiling any elements of the plot, The Prince has one of the best comments on the "honourable" death since Wilfred Owen.

My husband and I were watching a YouTuber review this movie a few weeks ago when we decided to watch it and see for ourselves... and as bad as it is - here I am two weeks later writing this as I force my best friend to watch it. This movie was really hard to follow, slightly cringy, and some of the camera angles were a bit interesting. I would have loved some more filler and insight on the love story between Rene and Devon since that seemed to be a big theme. My favorite character has to be Antonio's mother - lord her facial expressions trying to remember her lines was so funny and the laugh at the end was fantastic. So for that I give this movie 4 stars.

No pun intended - depending on where you are, you may get a title for this reading "Night of the Assassin". It makes sense that an Assassin is going on about his business at night. Still that does not mean, we only get to see him then. Or for "one night only" - there are more than one night(s) here. Just saying and clarifying for those interested.

This movie is maybe one of the best samples to be singled out for the movie viewers how a movie was completely ruined by the choice of soundtrack. I really don't know if hiring a guy to do the supporting sound effects music is the job of the producers or the director. But the music that syncs with every scene with such ridiculous cartoon-like comic music in this movie is such unbearable torture, making the movie very difficult to take seriously and pulling me into it. There are so many times when the leading actor deals with some situations that he encounters, the tip-toes-like annoying childish soundtrack would goof up; the situations may be intense and suspenseful, but the music simply turns them into a comic-like crap.
Night of the Assassin is a lot deeper than surface-level action or a story of vengeance.

Nada Que Ver (2023) aims to be a quirky comedy with heart but falls short due to its weak script and uneven pacing. While the premise has potential, the humor feels forced, and the characters lack depth, making it difficult to connect with their journeys.

Ove Beat the Hell Out of Me is one of those rare films that somehow manages to be boring and chaotic at the same time. It feels like the writers dumped a box of random scenes on the floor and said, "Yeah... that's a script." The pacing is a disaster, the dialogue sounds like it was generated by an AI with a bad attitude, and the acting swings between stiff, confused, and "please let this scene end."

This is definitely one of the movies ever made! The characters speak words written for them by the writer! The camera catches all of the movements of the actors as they move from place to place in the scene! Would I say this is a bad movie?? Aw hell to the Nah Nah!! Would I say this is a good movie?? You guessed it; Aw hell to the Nah Nah!! Do you need a tripod to make a movie?? Nope! Can you bring back a character you've just killed with no explanation?? Yup! Can you end a movie when feel like you've done enough filming and stuff?? Apparently!! 10/10 highly recommended! My review was too short so I'm ......

This movie far surpassed my expectations. The genius story telling, the mind bogglingly well written characters, the amazing character building, and even the extremely shocking plot twist made this movie an amazing watch. This film is gripping from start to end. You are so upset it is over because it is one of the movies of all time. Honeslty i recommend this film to every group of people as the visuals and the acting are second to none. The pacing was amazing and it was insanely funny. I was recommended this and i want to recommend it to the community. This film is insane and i love how they go from a feeling of emptiness inside at the start and then the feeling of all hope lost during the action packed middle scenes. The ending is one of the best endings i have ever seen as it is just something everyone needs to watch.

The story is not only led by an amazing cast, the plot is exceptional. The story revolves around a beautiful young woman that loses the most important gift she has to return home to be cared for by caretakers that make her feel as if she was handicapped. Then there comes a young man, with this own struggles for a job without expectations of anything in life. The story quickly turns when we see the true colors of each and the necessity to rely on one another to see through the hard times. Its incredible how the power of love can overcome even the hardest struggles but also the cost of sacrifice that may not always provide a return to the one who gives. An unexpected story of sacrifice from the one you least expect it.

As I sat down to watch the 2023 Chinese creature feature "Deep Sea Python", I must admit that I was figuring it to be just another run-of-the-mill creature feature that has been spewed out from the Chinese cinema these past few years. Yet, I still opted to sit down and watch what writer Zhang Lin and director Wang Qing had to offer, as it was a movie that I hadn't already seen.

Phew! If at all there was a movie for whose sequel I had been waiting for long, it was this! I saw the first part in theatre in January 2018 and since then, there was this urge of seeing what the second part would come up with.
It's the mix of emotions and drama. 1st half keeps audiance engaged,2nd half drags more and make movie feel slow moving.

A very feel good movie after Seetharamam. Didn't expect that manisharma gave this youthful music for the movie. Songs and bgm are major plus for the movie. Casting is very good. A very clean movie. Madhubala looks too young in the movie. I loved shiva and maya chemistry. Megha Akash could have been used more, felt she is limited. Padamule levu pilla song is too good. Comedy could have been added. This movie is not like old Premadesam but it has its own positives and it's own negatives. But definitely movie is a worth watch. One more thing, Thanikella Bharani and viva Harsha are limited to small roles.

Chal Man Jeetva Jaiye 2 is a Gujarati movie released on 24 Feb, 2023. The movie is directed by Dipesh Shah and featured Harsh Khurana, Rajeev Mehta, Hemen Chauhan and Sheetal Pandya as lead characters. Other popular actor who was roped in for Chal Man Jeetva Jaiye 2 is Dharmendra Gohil.

Chal Man Jeetva Jaiye 2 is a heartwarming Gujarati film that explores the theme of family values and the importance of unity. The movie follows the journey of a joint family as they face various challenges and learn to overcome them together. The film is well-crafted and engaging, with an excellent cast that delivers impressive performances. The cinematography and music complement the storyline beautifully, making for an overall enjoyable viewing experience. The movie is a great reminder of the significance of family and how coming together can help overcome any obstacle. With its relatable storyline and impressive execution, Chal Man Jeetva Jaiye 2 is a must-watch for those looking for an entertaining and heartwarming family drama.

Many years back watched 1st part which was phenomenal and expectation for the 2nd part was very high. After watching 2nd part, it was very awesome movie to watch. Regional (Gujarati) movies these days are fantastic to watch. It has met all the expectations in 2nd part.

Unlike the first part which was amazing and till date the best movie in Gujarati this part 2 does not standout like first one. I am biggest fan of part 1 and will always be, but I must say this that part 2 disappointed. Especially with its execution. Part 1 was very simple yet powerful in screenplay but second part is complex and very preachy. For sure it wants to give a learning but the whole treasure hunt part made it very messy. Had it sticked to practical happenings in Sanghvi house it would have been great like it was in first part. Ending is also very abrupt and unsatisfying as audience. I would eagerly wait for part 3 but also would not want it to be like part 2.

"Chal Man Jitva Jaiye Part 2" is a film that truly moved me. The message it conveys is powerful and thought-provoking, and I believe it has the potential to change lives. The film follows a family's journey to overcome their challenges and teaches us important lessons about the value of determination, perseverance, and family unity.

One of the best movie on self-development which can be re-watched countless amount of times, especially during tough situations. People forget that this movie was made to help people get more control of their mind in-order to attain success. I have already re-watched it 3 times and learning more from it each time. It shows how the vices of the mind take over as soon as you start something new ( a good habit ).

"Chal Man Jeetva Jaiye 2" is an absolute gem of a film that left me utterly captivated from start to finish. This cinematic masterpiece not only entertains but also resonates deeply with its audience through its compelling storyline and stellar performances.

Both points were valid independently, but I failed to see the correlation between the two. While I think a documentary "like" this should be made, the whole thing was a mess. There was no sense in between points and it left me wondering what I gained from watching this. The people who they were able to gain input from are incredibly influential in the space industry and the points they made were insightful. However, at no point did I understand the connection between the two story lines and it felt like I was watching two separate documentaries at the same time.

For all humankind tries to turn coincidences into causality. Although the film Implies it, there is no correlation between intense race-related social uprising moments, and mankind's biggest victories when it comes to space exploration.
Directly from The Science Channel's news release:

I found this documentary very interesting and thought provoking. I don't understand the other comments about conspiracy theories unless they believe the fight for civil rights is a conspiracy...not enough docs on the fight for civil rights in the world of space exploration. I liked the unexpected interviews, not the same old types of people, like Gloria Steinem and Star Trek's Sonequa Martin-Green, two women you wouldn't expect to see and I found that refreshing. Nice to see Don Lemon and all the astronauts. And the Star Wars reveal with actor guy was unexpected and poignant. Archival footage was riveting. I'd say an overall good watch.

With so many formulaic films, it's rare to find one that can surprise me. Publish or Perish is a breath of fresh air. Superbly acted by Timothy McCracken, deftly directed by David Liban and intricately edited by Justin Lewis. Cast and crew from Colorado, creates a celebration of local artists and dark comedy at its best! My husband and teenage son and I enjoyed seeing this on the big screen at the Denver film festival. Looking forward to sharing it with friends and family and watching it again where it's streaming on Apple TV. Do yourselves a favor and check it out. I imagine teachers and professors will find this especially satisfying and cathartic!

If I could give 100 stars to this movie I would. The story is so unique. Not very often you see a movie about the protocols in academia. Even through some audiences won't know about the specifics because they haven't lived it, it still relatable to everyone. The movie is funny in the way things are spoken about and how the storytelling develops. The directing is magnificent. The cinematography, editing and actors work is exceptional. I recommend it to people who enjoy dark comedies that are well structured. I fully connected with the story and the characters in a very special way. And believe me when I say I am very critical of movies. This film is one of a kind! Well done to the production team!
I had the pleasure to see "Publish or Perish" theatrically for the first time at the Oceanside Intenational Film Festival.
"Publish or Perish," the latest film from writer-director David Liban, is a tense and thought-provoking dark comedy that explores the dark side of ambition and obsession.
As a former professor of English, I can attest that there is nothing more petty than university politics. It's a topic worthy of satire, and this film delivers it. But there are some major flaws.
Easily one of the top 5 films I've seen in 2023... A filmmaker with a real vision.

Little known fact to those outside academia circles, the title, "Publish or perish" is not a clever alliteration created by the director, but actually an age old aphorism describing the pressure to publish academic work in order to succeed in an academic career, first used in 1928. This institutional pressure can feel life or death for many young professors seeking tenure, which is the only academic appointment that protects them from being let go without cause.

This funny dark comedy will keep you riveted to your seats throughout! The storyline centers around an English professor obsessed by securing a tenured position in a college but a number of unusual events in his life places unexpected and unusual obstacles in his path. Some scary moments but they are largely balanced by really funny scenes and sometimes subtle humor. This movie will make you wonder throughout, how it possibly could end, in light of all improbable situations encountered by the main character.

This is a very entertaining movie. They did great work with Cinematography and their story, I was intrigued the whole time. They kept me waiting to see what happens next. Acting was phenominal and theres a goofiness to the horror which makes it more of a unique film. The intensity plus casualness to the whole plot makes it worth wild. I was constantly wondering where this story was going, which is great for me because I can usually figure out what is going to happen when I watch a movie. If you have not seen it, I recommend this movie! Watched it twice in a day! Definitley a good find. Great work on all cast and crew.
Saddled with a somewhat ungainly flashback structure, SHYLOCK'S CHILDREN takes as its central conceit the legacy of a debt - even if the money is returned, can the obligation ever truly be repaid?

Mal Viver dives into the complexity of human relationships in a way that draws the viewer attention. In my opinion, the way Canijo builds tension and depth within a single location, is almost similar to an Hitchcock movie.

This Portuguese film (Bad Living) is the first part of a diptych of two films, both made by director Joao Canijo and released in 2023. "Bad Living" won the Silver Bear for the 2nd best film in competition at the 2023 Berlin Film Festival. The second film has the mirror title (Living Bad) and was also shown at the same edition of the festival in the parallel Encounters section. Joao Canijo's direction, scriptwriting, and conceptualization of the diptych makes one sit up. Both films have the same actors, with their screen-time inverted. "Bad Living" details an all women cast, of a family spread over three live generations, owning a hotel and their complex relationships. "Living Bad" is about the mirror world of a group of guests arriving at the hotel, with the same hotel owners dealing with their problems in the periphery. More interestingly, "Bad Living" is loosely based on the director's childhood (ref. IMDB trivia). "Living Bad" relates to the guests' interactions with the hotel owners and their traumas. Most interestingly, director Canijo structures the films on the lines of the works of writer-theosophist August Strindberg--whose works were influenced by his own life that switched from anti-Semitism to free thinking to atheism and, finally, back to religion. While I write this, I have yet to view the second part of the diptych. I will take keen interest henceforth in director/screenplaywriter Canijo's works. Finally, the ensemble cast of "Bad Living" impressed me.
I have to begin this review by saying that after years of using IMDb to consult ratings I've never felt the need to create an account until now, to rate & review this film.

A very well-made film in many ways. Complex and dense. A pearl among superficial formulas. Memorable performances, great script and cinematography. A realistic drama about human complexity and the weight that many people carry in their lives. While most films are pure entertainment (and there is no problem with that), films like this are necessary, not only to get out of the ordinary, but also to help us better understand people and their attitudes. My greetings to the producers, the director and screenwriter and everyone involved in this production. My wife and I left amazed and even now, we have conversations about the immense number of layers and situations involving the characters.

Mal Viver is more than a film; is an immersive experience into the minefield of family relationships, where love and resentment coexist in a non-stop dance. Canijo's work invites us to reflect on the weight of family ties and the role of physical space in the formation of memories and conflicts. With careful direction and an almost documentary approach, JoÃ£o Canijo transforms a seaside hotel into a stage for the tragedy and beauty of human coexistence. It is an invitation to the viewer to look inside themselves, through the eyes of a family that, despite its flaws, seeks to survive together, even when the past and wounds insist on manifesting themselves.

Documentary based on views of one political party, it's highly propaganda and biased documentary. Authentic documentary should contain the views of both parties. In short we could say that, "Behind the Closed Door" falls short of its promise to provide an unbiased exploration of its matter. Instead, the documentary promotes a biased narrative, selectively represents information, and fails to include alternative viewpoints. Its lack of fact-checking, emotional manipulation, and dismissal of counterarguments further undermine its credibility. As responsible consumers of media, it is essential to approach such documentaries critically and seek out alternative sources that provide a more balanced perspectiv.

To compound the anguish, approximately 15,000 individuals find themselves incarcerated for exercising their democratic right to protest against the reign of the Shareef clan.

Great documentary. Great effort. I am glad imdb team have plugged the courage and educate the world about how the 3rd world country leaders who comes in power with people's votes suddenly become rich elites and start amassing huge swathe of wealth in offshore setup companies. This documentary also highlights the fact, how the western democracies turn blind eye to this corruption and let the corrupt leaders and the families of third world country leaders gain access to diplomatic support and later residency and citizenship visas. The nexus of western governments is also exposed subliminally in this documentary.

Europy Union, United Nations and worldwide organizations should say no to these currupt MLs,
A ship can't move on to top when there is hole between the lines.

title: Yi Shu Xue Yuan 1994
production_company: China Academy Of Art's School of Animation & Game

review_text: Art College 1994 tells a story of a group of friends studying at an unnamed art school in the early 90s China. They go through their everyday lives as people in their early twenties tend to anywhere in the world: being brave, lazy, and foolish; questioning the meaning of life and the meaning of art; falling in love and experiencing heartbreak; dreaming of possible and impossible futures; drinking beer; listening to music; laughing; throwing stones into the river.
We've often heard about "Change Is Constant." With changing times, the manner of making movies and the kind of content to be shown in it is changing too.
Premiered back at the 73rd Berlin International Film Festival.

Starting is very good as you can the heist is taking the form but after the Iqbal's quantity rising scene per scene is too much. Also we know if bollywood or south make this, than everyone accepted. But the cameraman did the worst job, to make every scene intense he shoot everyone's face in close up. Too much close up in every scene. Also too much other slow scenes, taking too much time to deliver the dialogues. Why too much songs in this suspense and mystery genre movie?? Acting was perfect of everyone. Strange thing that one Journalist working on the CBI case. Hope they not spoil the Iqbal 2.

I think the movie was an attempt to copy hollywood / bollywood style with some vague story telling in the name of getting something fresh and unique on the table. Not sure why would the writer and director attempt the second part when first was so random.

I will start with PROs:
1. Great script, hands down to the writer. It keeps you invested in the movie and guessing how and where it will go from every turn in the movie.

Story:
Main hero of the movie is storyline. The best written of movie is it's story line.

The Unique story you never seen in any Hollywood or Bollywood, Must watch Hun Iqbal movie,. Story is too good But Directer was trying to long story and scenes. For gujarati industry it's too good to for new contant, this movie actor need more acting level and expression with dialogues,. The writer has used his brain well but some scenes are too long which will make you feel bored. ...Some overacting has been shown too much which can be known only by seeing
For story 5/5
For acting 3.5/5
For climex 5/5
For movie directory of movie 4/5
Overall good movie je loko ne kantado ocho aave che a loko maate must.
One & only plus point about the film is novel story , such that can make every Gujarati cinegoer proud . But the good thing stops here .

Movie plot is good, but spoiled by unnecessary smoking scenes. The inspector smokes as if that is so important for the character. The women reporter also overacts, drinks, and smokes. Her behavior is unnecessarily mimics prostitute which isn't good for Gujarati cinema or audience. A good movie is spoiled by two characters and their stupid character building using alcohol and cigarettes. I would have rated this movie higher if smoking and alcohol was not shown. Also, lady reporter role should have been given to someone else a better fit....let's hope next time this movie writer producer director consider some cleanliness.

What makes a great thriller? It's a deceptively broad genre that can be as hard to pin down as "Character Iqbal". The span takes in everything from slow-burn noodle-twisters like south movie "Chakra" little close but diff stoey plot. This film close to noirs, heist movies, crime capers, psychological head scratchers and current digital capability of Gujarati cinema.

The cinematography, all the camera angles and the lightings in many of the scene is awful. The pacing of the film is real pain for the viewers as well. The story had a great potential but it seemed apparent that they didn't know how to end the movie, The ending seemed very abrupt and tease of sequel used as a tool to buy some time to write the story forward, which should be considered shameful from the writer and director of the movie. The story, background music and acting from few individuals made the movie worth. I would not suggest people to watch it in theatre and wait for it to showup on OTT. It felt as if making suspense movie is not a cup of tea for the director no matter how much some people praise him for it.

Waste of Time
Thr story base is unique but it got completely wasted as the movie does not move an inch since the beginning. The overexaggerated smoking scenes by lead actors and unwanted roll of RJ Devaki wastes the length of the movie further. The CBI chief seems to need some medical help as he always feels demotivated from the first scene.

The story base is unique but it got completely wasted as the movie does not move an inch since the beginning. The overexaggerated smoking scenes by lead actors and unwanted roll of RJ Devaki wastes the length of the movie further. The CBI chief seems to need some medical help as he always feels demotivated from the first scene.

A quiet study in the disappointments in life, told primarily from the perspective of a middle-aged man who is divorced from his wife, estranged from his father, and has set aside his dreams of writing poetry to become an online food critic. He develops a relationship with the much younger woman who takes photographs for him, and despite her quirky charm, we find that she's dealing with her own emotional baggage stemming from being adopted as a child. Meanwhile his elderly father who once served a year of hard labor for allegedly groping a woman on a bus, a charge he denied (and we're led to believe was untrue), has been bicycling 300km to Beijing to catch glimpses of him and his sister on their birthdays, unbeknownst to them. The man's ex-wife? Terminal cancer. His friends? They range from having multiple divorces, to being despondent over never having married, to committing suicide.

I have seen two other movies by Zhang Lu, set in Korea, with Korean actors, and I felt dissatisfied to some extent with both of them. This is the one I liked best. I guess I resonate much more with the Chinese-ness of the characters. They are more relatable in a way, they make much more sense to me. I also liked the locales, the old houses and streets. It is a bloated movie, there are scenes that could've been cut, maybe a good half hour of it. But this resonated with me, I found myself interested and drawn to some of the characters and their stories. I liked Ouyang Wenhui the least probably, unlike Park So-dam's character in Ode to the Goose. But the rest of them I wanted to know more about. Even Gu's poor renter has a pretty good scene. His sister, daughter, brother-in-law, his ex, his old school friends, his dad, his mom. I wanted more time with them instead of semi-dreamscape passages but it's ok. I'm glad I had the patience for it.

title: Az almafa virÃ¡ga
production_company: HCM City Movie Association Film Studios

review_text: This film is a great surprise and quite a remarkable story. I thought I knew where the plot was going, but the director did a great job at entertaining and captivating the audience. For instance, humor often happens when you expect things to get dark and violent. Of the three main characters, the most mature is actually the youngest (Jeremy is in high school and 15 years younger than Beth and Steve).

title: Jalan yang Jauh, Jangan Lupa Pulang

review_text: This film has a grit and raw feel that was captured well in every performance. The plot moves well and the action is fast paced. I had a chance to catch the original The Gods, and the relationships established in the first really set this movie up nicely. I found myself actually caring about the characters, which good writing will do. From the outset of the start, the film moves nicely and doesn't let up. A definite popcorn flick as they're described. Mykel Jenkins is a tour de force of intensity and strength. If you're into gritty, character-driven action movies, then this is a must watch for you.

I'm a fan of action, thriller and comedy. Last thing I want to see is a romantic drama. But as a Hungarian I had to watch this movie. I am very glad that I did. The flow is great. The storyline is very interesting, some investigative work involved, keep you guessing till the end. Never boring, kept me interested the whole time. Great to see 2 nations Hungary and Vietnam coming together in a positive way. Goes to show you that human feelings and love for one and another have no borders regardless where you from. Really well acted by everyone as well. Just watch it and you will not be disappointed.

I thoroughly enjoyed thus Action packed thriller. Kepy me on the edge of my seat from beginning to ends. The acting was spectacular . Love, revenge, violence and humor. What else do you need excellent movie.t i was especially. Connected to the story about the brothers. For me it's not do much the fight as it is what you!'re fighting for. Some of the shot were especially long which i realky liked. Felt like real life and i really appreciated that. The way it wS shot. And the musical score was perfect, the Asian female lead was quite a treat. Beautiful comfortable in her skin. And really helped the story along.

It was an amazing movie that had me on the edge of my seat! This movie is a must watch with great actors that the brought the emotion to every scene. The story line connected very well with the first movie. The music was incredible and added the suspense to each scene. Definitely made me connect more with the intensity and drama of what was happening in the movie. Action-packed thriller that kept me wanting more. Looking forward to the potential of a third movie coming out. Mykel Jenkins was phenomenal as the writer, director, and lead in this film. The movie was absolutely incredible from the very beginning to the end!

Love this series. I watched both the gods movie in one weekend. I enjoyed the second movie more than the first and you can tell that the production quality is at another level. Seeing the characters develop from the gods 1 to the gods 2 peaked my interest from the very start of the movie. Mikey and his crew are running this town!! Of course I'm left with some huge cliffhangers which will make the gods 3 awesome! Can't wait to see what they come up with next. I'm most excited to see Chris go from a child in the first movie to a teen in the second and now I'm guessing an absolute unit of a man when gods 3 comes out. Sequel can't come soon enough!

This film was amazing I loved the acting in it and the story line was amazing. Actors truly embodied their characters and I felt the emotional tension and message from the film. I like the emphasis on the importance of family and how it can tear a man apart when it's disrupted especially as a black man. The father and son bond in the film was awesome I can't wait for the next film in this Saga. The drug game is petty game and leaves no room for being soft but in reality we are human and I can appreciate the realness from the actors as they showed vulnerability in such a masculine world known as the drug world. This film had me on the edge of my seat as it will have you on yours.

Great film. Excellent interpersonal drama. Terrific cinematography and musical background kept the tension and mood. I enjoyed the expert blend of the action sequences with gripping drama. The attuned interaction of the cast creates a thrilling and emotionally resonant story that keeps you on the edge of your seat from start to finish. The performances are top-notch. The film's action sequences are not just there for spectacle, but are instead grounded in character and story, which makes the scenes and outcome all the more thrilling and impactful. Gripping storylines that leave a lasting emotional impact.
This movie is a very well written drama filled with intense emotion.

Another great one by Jenkins! This film picks up where Gods 1 ended. My wife and I enjoyed this from start to finish. The story was compelling and kept us guessing. There's everything in it you'd want from a movie: good direction, solid acting, action, terrible villains, heroes to root for, heartbreak, revenge and redemption. And what a breakout film for Bryce Jenkins - his character is well acted, passionate, and intriguing. A star in the making for sure. Make sure to watch all the way to the end! I would recommend this to anyone who likes thrilling, action-packed movies. Don't miss out on this one!

I most definitely was glued to that screen from top to bottom!!! Wow. Mykel Shannon Jenkins has done it again! Incredible work- gifted cast, on-point writing, directing, cinematography (that opening aerial shot for starters!) and even the colors just brilliant and executed well!!! High intense emotion throughout this film took me on a ride for sure. ALL the fighting scenes felt & looked too real...like i literally could not tell if they were stunts or actually fighting wow. I just can't make this stuff up!! I recommend this movie to anyone who enjoys watching suspense thriller movies- lots of twists, mystery and ACTION!!!

Mykel Shannon Jenkins, does it again. This man can do it all. The writing, the directing and starring in this classic film. He knows how to take the viewer on a ride. The way it was shot made it feel like watching real life. It starts right out of the gate. Had me on the edge of my seat. I highly recommend watching the first one, The Gods, and then watch this one. The movie is so well cast as well as the musical score to go with it. I loved the brothers relationship. This film has it all-love story, revenge and a bit of humor. Mikey is such a badass. I cannot wait for another one. Let's hope this story continues with the ever so talented Bryce Clyde Jenkins!

After watching "Gods 2" you may feel a little on edge. It isn't a simple 'revenge' theme. The dynamics, acting and plot all seem to be heading into a message about the cost of 'justice' being higher than the cost of the injustice, but the message seems secondary to what I liked about this film.

The Gods 2 is a thrill-ride that not only keeps you on the edge of your seat, but it also pulls you in with its complex characters and rich relationships. Mykel Shannon Jenkins gives a nuanced and seasoned performance as a man trapped in a world that's destroying everything he loves. Embodying a character broken by PTSD and flashbacks from his heartbreaking past, Jenkins weaves a web of raw emotions that is seldom seen in this genre, and it's what takes this film to another level. It's hard to believe this film wasn't produced by a major studio with a huge budget. For Jenkins to have written, produced, directed and starred in this film is nothing short of miraculous. Other outstanding performances by Kevin Interdonato and Antony SauvÃ© make this film a joy to watch for anyone who loves the art of acting.

Highly recommend The Gods - both the original and this sequel number 2. Mykel is so so special and fun to watch. He lights up the screen with his passion and ability to subtly convey the inner workings of his mind, down to his deepest, most raw, heart wrenching feelings. Brilliantly executed. The relationship and dynamic between these brothers is great and just so real, and makes the story so relatable. The perfect combination of action packed and with a love story sprinkled in, what a ride. I was completely invested in the story and how it was going to end. It's a great cast and I'm looking forward to the possibility of a 3rd!!

Such a well rounded movie. Family and Enemies. Violence and Love. Humor and Drama... the film really kept you engaged and entertained throughout... hopefully there's a Gods 3 because they keep getting better!

Absolutely fell in love with the riveting characters and thrilling storyline. Anthony and Mikey James were absolutely amazing. The best possible way to spend a Saturday night. MUST SEE. Watching these three brothers band together and seemingly combat overwhelming odds to not lose everything takes you on a wild ride that had me glued to the screen and on the edge of my seat. Phantom was another one of my favorite characters. You think he's the ultimate big bad until the full story unravels and you see the truth colors motivating the madness and it is truly touching. I cannot wait to see where this story goes! Incredible acting with beautiful cinematography, anyone who loves good movies and touching art work will love this film.
Amazing work yet again from Jenkins. I really enjoyed this action packed movie. I enjoyed the first movie and the sequel did not disappoint.
Unlike some sequels, the Gods 2 matches, if not surpasses its predecessor.

Mykel has done it again! He does an absolute wonderful job in every scene! The dynamic between all three bothers is precious. Love seeing these black men coming together. I also love the Italian scenes. Felt like the godfather vs sugar hill kind of movie. I highly recommend. Especially if you have tubi. It's free!!!!!!!!!!

Wonderful movie full of incredible actors. With beautiful cinematography and color, The Gods 2 is a telling story that goes into depth about what it really means to think with your emotions. It's a story about loss, feeling stuck, and hopelessness, but overall, growth as a person. The music was wonderful and appropriate for its corresponding scenes--and what's interesting is that all of it was made by Mykel Jenkins's own brother! I latched onto the characters easily, feeling both their heartwarming and heartbreaking moments. Overall, I found myself submerged in this movie, having genuine reactions, and constantly at the edge of my seat. Definitely recommend.

It's been a heartwarming journey watching the latest feature from director, screenwriter and producer Angga Dwimas Sasongko "Jalan Yang Jauh Jangan lupa Pulang". This film has succeeded to touch everyone's heart with its story of running away from the past, finding self-freedom, friendship and abusive relationship. As a sequel, "Jalan Yang Jauh" is certainly able to match the level of its predecessor (Nanti Kita Cerita Tentang Hari Ini) - with a narrower scope of conflict, this film even has a better ending. Of course what can't be forgotten is how Sheila Dara once again proved her acting skills as a struggling young middle class woman (also Lutesha as my favorite scene stealer). Personally it's easy to say "Jalan Yang Jauh Jangan Lupa Pulang" is the best Indonesian drama of 2023...so far.

title: MÃ­ng tian bi zuo tian chang jiu

review_text: The Wraith Within is one of those home-made horror films.

Jow Zhi Wei's debut feature Tomorrow is a Long Time is worth watching for one reason, and that's the debut performance by first-time actor Edward Tan who plays Meng, the protagonist. Tan is flawless in a difficult role that calls for him to display a whole range of emotions over the course of the movie.

Follow families trying to ferret out the best way to give their children the ultimate skill for success -- reading. See the inspired educator and former Oakland Unified School District principal join the efforts of the NAACP to bring the science of reading to all public schools to provide equity to our most vulnerable populations.

I caught the movie at a local film festival. My slight disappointment was that it isn't a true story, but rather a composite story pieced together from shards of reality. The poetry used as a backdrop (both Farsi & Romanian) and the editing was very powerful and for me made the movie into a great thriller-documentary (although strictly speaking it is a work of fiction).

title: Barbie: Skipper and the Big Babysitting Adventure

review_text: I randomly bought tickets for this movie at my local film festival and I was totally caught off guard. The storytelling, the carefully chosen archival videos, the edting. They all manage to transport you into the character's experinces, thoughts and feelings. I would love to be able to see it again someday.

I saw the movie at the movie festival in Montreal, and stayed after for the discussion with the director. A thoughtful director of a powerful movie. The movie is a work of love and respect for women in repressive societies, but also more than that. The movie is structured around reading the letters (reminding me of Chantal Akerman's movie, Letters from home) wrote to each other between 2 women, one Romanian, the other Iranian, read on the background of social political events in both countries, mirroring each other's stolen dreams and revolutions. The story is constructed in the imagination of audience, an intimate powerful homage to women, their power, voice and inner force, who, even if repressed, are not victims in their inner worlds.
The 42nd Barbie movie and the first Barbie movie to have Skipper as a title character.

If you've been watching the world of Barbie Dreamhouse Adventures from the beginning, you'll see how Skipper has very pronounced character development. She starts out aloof and temperamental before turning into someone more mindful and responsible. This movie, the first project where she's the lead, shows how far she's come. Having it focus on her babysitting service is a pretty smart choice, as it allows her to show off how well she can adapt to any situation. She shows a great deal of leadership qualities, such as looking out for others and helping those that can't help themselves. Everything else about the movie works pretty well, such as how enjoyable the new characters are, Tammy gaining more depth, and the music being enjoyable. I definitely recommend checking this out.

When it comes to the character of Skipper, she's either just the complainer or someone who focuses too much on being cool, not really standing out that much. With the world of Barbie: Dreamhouse Adventures, she became a more nuanced and three dimensional character. Over the years, she becomes someone who's more mindful of others and more willing to do the right thing. This movie shows how well she's developed. The best way to describe this movie is with how we get to see more sides to her characters. She's fun and snarky, but also more willing to look out for others. She takes the initiative to make the most of herself and do what she can to help people find their voice. It's really fun to see her blossom and grow into someone who can make people feel safe and secure. She makes mistakes sure, but focuses more on doing the right thing. This helps to make the movie work.

This movie will keep you edge of the seat till the end .. climax has a beautiful message. It starts of as murder mystery, takes you to roller coasters . Very much different from template films. The investigations scenes are good .
An adventure sport vlogger has a dull job and lives for escape, posting videos online of her weekend activities and talking about them with her followers.

As someone from Aden, where The Burdened was filmed, I want to say this movie hits close to home. It shows a family facing the harsh reality of war, and the camera work makes you feel every moment. It's a touching story about sacrifice and strength, straight from our city. The cinematography skillfully captures the essence of Aden, immersing the audience in its unique atmosphere. The portrayal of the city's resilience adds a layer of authenticity, resonating with the audience on a profound level. The performances are compelling, breathing life into characters that reflect the spirit of our community. The Burdened not only tells a powerful story but also serves as a poignant tribute to the strength of Aden and its people, making it a must-watch for those seeking a film that goes beyond the screen to embrace the heart of a city amidst adversity.

title: Le grand chariot
roles: La femme au guichet de la mairie
Le metteur en scÃ¨ne de thÃ©Ã¢tre

review_text: "Tove's Room" takes place in Copenhagen in the 1960s where Tove Ditlevsen (Paprika Steen), one of the greatest female poets and authors of her time, is waiting a guest for lunch; the younger Modernist writer Klaus Rifbjerg (Joachim Fjelstrup) who is interested in discussing their common passion in litterature. Tove's husband Victor Andreasen (Lars Brygmann), who is the chief editor of Ekstra-Bladet, is also at home after his mistress has cancelled their appointment, but he is not excited for the company of Rifbjerg, as he suspect him of having an affair with Tove. However, he participate the lunch, where Rifbjerg ends up being the key witness to their dysfunctional and toxic relationship, where there isn't that far a distance between love and hate, and where sweet compliments are mixed in with malicious sarcasm from both parts.

Let me just preface this review by saying that I love Lifetime movies, even when they are "bad". Sometimes its fun to watch a mini soap opera for a couple of hours. That being said, I have found that the 2023 originals have been very disappointing so far.
Just like its name suggests it was a real deception. A complete waste of 1h23 minutes........

At first glance a perfect tender summer film unfortunately falls flat in its second half. "L'Amour du Monde" doesn't trouble itself with too much explanation at the beginning and instead lets us discover the protagonists' back-stories on our own throughout the duration of the film. Another thing that I would compliment is its beutiful cinematography that perfectly captures sunlight glittering on the water surface, soft tree shades in nearby forests and overall summer atmosphere. On the other hand I wish the story let us more into the characters minds and feelings, beacuse in my opinion all of them were kind of one-sided, superficial and blurry. The main theme that connected the three protagonists - loss of their mothers - was pleasing, but it got a bit lost in the narrative (untill the very end, when we were reminded of it again). Overall I don't think it was a bad film, just not exceptional enough.

I did not expect much from this movie but I expected at least some entertainment. The acting is good and the premise is also interesting. The whole movie feels like a student project. It is unbearable slow,which should allow for some good character development. But nothing. Soo many flashbacks, unlikable characters and some strange creative choices. But the absolute worst is the ending. Such an anti climax, pointless and not even slightly satisfying. I created this account just for the review. What a waste of time. Who expects ab action movie , this isn't it. For people that like character studies or drama, it will not be rewarding.
I totally agree with the review who rated this film 1 out of 10.
> updated review

A bride-to-be, Sira, crosses the vast and uninhabited desert with friends and family on the way to be with her lover. The word is out that she intends to marry someone outside of the Muslim faith. This fact draws the attention of armed extremists who attack the group, rough Sira up, and leave her to die. Yet Sira doesn't give up hope. Subsisting on raw lizard meat and wandering in the desert for days, Sira stumbles upon the terrorist camp. Here Sira intends to prove that there is more courage in wisdom and less in brutality and violence.

The story sounded promising. A man accused of murdering his daughter set free after 20 years coming back to his hometown to find answers and revenge. But the move gets a low pace very quickly. As soon as all the characters have been thoroughly introduced I was expecting some action. But it nothing happens. Until the very latest of the movie, when he finally wants to use violence, it's ended with an anticlimax. Although the acting is okay, it's just the story that fel short. Especially after watching a Scott Adkins action movie this one is very disappointing. Not sure why some rated it so high. For me it was utter waste of time.

Franks personal hell was extraordinary before and after prison. What would it take to bring the killer to justice? Would you be willing to die for the truth? Yes it's a slower movie but there's so much in what's not said as oppose to what's said. Frank is an ordinary man with problems when a tragedy befalls him. A must watch for people who understand irony.

title: Momo - The game of death
production_company: Red Incarnation a house of vision

review_text: Imagine a major Kollywood producer came to you and asked you to write an AI-gone-rogue story.....for Mirchi Shiva. Knowing his style, delivery and content, what would you write?
4S hit all the right buttons by introducing us to a metaverse world. Nonetheless, something was still missing to really get us excited

This is probably the first mockery kinda Tamil film made with AI with a decent plot that's good enough to keep us hooked but IDK why but I really don't like actors who act like acting in the films and Siva is the only person in Tamil film industry who's still surviving by doing this silly act for a very long period of time, so unsurprisingly he's the problem of this entire film since all his films follow the same pattern of mockery & comedy sequences, it makes this film unlikeable/unwatchable.

Out and out entertainment with mostly comedy screenplay with bit of love and emotions. It is a really good romcom movies in recent time. All the characters performed really well. Except one unwanted daddy character played by Mano sir, it is totally unnecessary for the movie track. Creativity of what an AI phone can do gone crazy, excellent, at times, it felt like mix of classic "Zee Boom Baa" movie and modern Enthiran. Carried all the emotions in a perfect way to the extent, it made me to think me as a character within the movie. Very satisfied with performances, directions, animation and all the team work. Animations in the climx feels bit funny but does not spoil the mood of the movie. I used to be fan of Shiva but his recent movies really upset me a lot for which this movie came as a enjoyable bonanza. Kudos to everyone. Expecting well crafted Part 2.

I was so happy to catch this film at our local film festival but have never been able to see it elsewhere. I really hope it gets distributed to the masses. It is such a wonderful and touching story and a very authentic feel. The lead actor directed the film as well and it looks like it is his debut but you wouldn't know it from the quality of the film. I hesitate to say more as it seems that I'm drawn to films with shocking moments or twists but I will say that I thoroughly enjoyed it!

The plot twist in this movie is not too surprising because it is already hinted through the dialogue of one of the characters. So this movie will most likely not be suitable for those who like watching heavy themes and full of surprises.
A man whose family killed during house robbery, got to meet the robbers after 2 years. During the first encounter, what is the spontaneous urge? Nothing other than killing for sure?

I tried to give this Ukrainian movie the benefit of doubt, but it caved in to the typical cliched nonsense and predictable coincidental meet-ups that bring with it gratuitous sex scenes that resemble two people suffering an epileptic fit.

Plot sounds and looks original. Only if you've not seen movies with an ensemble cast who gather together as possible suspects for the murder of a rich patriarch. Sounds like the comedy mystery, critically acclaimed original movie "Knives Out". I guess the producers of this movie got inspired after watching it they decided to make a Filipino version "Knives Out". Very original. Just when the Philippine movie industry needed the push to jumpstart its resurgence, they come up with a lame copy of a whodunnit. That's why I can't even bring myself to finish the movie. Kudos though that Prime is carrying this.

I watched Do You Love Me? When it screened at the Gothenburg Film Festival, and it stayed with me in a quiet, persistent way. Years later, while compiling a personal list of films about love, I realized how vividly I remembered this film emotionally, even though I could not immediately name it again.
Watched this because it's the first Filipino offering by Amazon Prime and it was Jun Lana, after all. I guess I hoped too much.

It's definitely a breath of fresh air to get to see this kind of Filipino movie. Part of their marketing is that this is the first AmazonPrime-produced filipino movie and i'd say it really did not disappoint. I would not say this is original since It's taking pages off Agatha Christie's novels - i observed touches of 'Ten Little Indians' (And Then There Were None), 'ABC Murder'. 'Black Coffee' and 'Murder on the Orient Express'. But since Christie's novels aren't really big here in Asia it would pass to be something new for Filipinos. Execution and script is great - It embodied local culture discussing the reality in a life of a mistress, female empowerment and self-respect. Concept is well executed and the satirical aspects were timely. Cinematography is great and I think the production team did a great job selecting the actor/actresses. Kudos to all the 'mistresses' as they were all brilliant in their own way. I just think it would have been better if each of the mistresses' backstory (or murder motive) were highlighted -as that would have added to the mystery theme. It would have been generic had it not been for the comedic antics and sequences. It was a fun movie overall and definitely above average. Thumbs up to all the cast and crew for a well-delivered, enjoyable 2 hours.

First of all, I want to start by talking about the production values. The film is visually stunning, with luxurious sets and beautiful costumes that bring the world of the movie to life. The attention to detail in each of the mistresses' looks is particularly impressive, giving us a sense of their individual personalities. I think the production design team has done an excellent job.

Upon watching the trailer, I was unamused. However, I still had a good feeling about the movie. So, I gave it a try. As I was watching the movie, I am starting to get hooked. The acting are unlike others. I really loved it!! There are so many scenes I had hard time containing my laughter. The storyline and the denouement is nothing of expectation! So, I loved how my "oh this storyline/outcome is typical" thinking is constantly challenged by the movie. Kudos to the actors and actresses. They are SO good at acting! Great job for the director/s and writers! Very very nice movie! I hope more movies like this are to come. All the best for the makers of this movie, and everyone else who is involved.

This is the second film I've seen starring Jet Jandreau and while I liked The Vigilante for what it was, she's undeniably much better in this black, psychological low-key thriller set in the Prohibition era. Baring all, body and soul, Jet gives a remarkably subtle performance as a put-upon wife with unspoken desires. She makes the film her own.

Not only was this movie dark, gritty, and highlighted the human emotions; it gave you a sense of dread that most movies don't capture. The cast encapsulated a time in the upper peninsula of Michigan that has never been seen. The story unfolds in the prohibition era and is true to the times and shows you an experience that is true to the times not only then but also now, with first hand experience through the writing and acting.
I stumbled upon this film while trying to find obscure under the radar movies on Amazon. The cover art really drew me to it. I watched the trailer and I was immediately hooked.

Absolutely brilliant movie that was both elegant and haunting. Highlighting a time and place in this country that has never been explored before that encapsulates a unique group of people who you have never seen.

Not funny enough to be called a comedy, not dramatic enough to be a drama, not cosy enough for a family movie, and not sexy enough for an erotic one. This movie attempts to combine all the four, but fails at every one. With all it's inaccuracies it is not even a good tourism add for Norway. The only ones with a reason to be happy with this movie are the manufacturer of the camper van. Their product is treated like a star, close ups, interior shots and driving around in lovelly Norwegian nature. Most of the footage shot in and around Bergen. Sotra, Ã˜ygarden and Kalandseid for those with local knowledge. In addition to Bergen there are also some footage from Oslo, Nordkapp and the Viking town in Gudvangen, plus some footage from Italy. Oh, and there are some cute puppies too. And a bear.
On the Adamant

I don't know if there is something lost in translation or if it's a cultural thing, but this Polish romantic comedy seems a bit juvenile. Monika and Enzo have managed to milk this romance into three films and this is the third and (hopefully) final film (aka the wedding). I am actually happy that I persisted in watching all three films as this may be the best of the three. It is definitely better than number two and doesn't have all the terrible disguises of the first film.

The film is a portrait of the L'Adamant Day Center in Paris. This is a floating building located at the foot of the Charles de Gaulle Bridge on the right bank of the Seine. The unique daycare center welcomes adults with mental disorders from the first four arrondissements of Paris. It offers patients a daily routine that is structured in terms of time and space and helps them to regain their footing in everyday life with therapeutic workshops and psychosocial rehabilitation support. The Adamant team consists of psychiatrists, psychologists, nurses, occupational therapists, specialist educators, psychomotor specialists, care coordinators, hospital staff, and various external artists and art therapists.
It's a delicate diamond work. It might seem slow, but it all is real. You observe people with mental disabilities in one of the neighborhoods in Paris, France. You're there and with them.

title: Thalaikoothal
